column2: We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence / Data Analyst to join our product team    in India    to help lead Aspire through an exciting period of growth. As a BI Analyst, you will enable data-driven discovery, data self-serve, and data insights for the entire company. You will also use your customer obsession, data analysis expertise to power product embedded analytics for our key customers. You will own our internal BI reporting stack and ensure accurate and timely analytics to power data driven decisions for the company s leadership team. You will work closely with leaders across the organization to deliver value to our internal team and key customers.      As a BI Analyst, you are responsible for the entire data lifecycle of our internal analytics platform - from ingestion of data across sources to ETL process to refine data to Tableau powered visualizations. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, technically strong, approaches complex business questions with data and curiosity, and loves to identify trends and casualty and help the teams make decisions.          What youll be working on:       Define the BI operations playbook and technical strategy for self-serve insights platform for the organization     Understand our business model, customers and our products to identify strategic insights, inform leadership, and recommend execution plans against analytical insights     Work closely with PM, engineering and other functions to bring all the data across the organization into a central analytics fabric     Lead strategic analytics initiatives and present insights to key stakeholders to drive actions and impact     Act as a problem solver within the team, addressing challenges and finding innovative solutions to enhance overall BI operational effectiveness     Be proficient and an owner for ETL, data visualization and BI operations platforms     Develop cross-team relationships with senior stakeholders to ensure we are meeting existing analytics needs and prepared to meet the needs of the future     Closely collaborate with our Marketing, Sales, and Customer Experience teams to understand their needs and deliver insights to move the business forward           What were looking for:      (Job Requirements/Must have)        3+ years experience in a BI / Data analyst role at SaaS companies     Demonstrated ability to define and deliver self serve BI insights      Strong grasp of tools like Tableau, Stitch / ETL tools, and other data tools.     Strong data visualization sensibility - a keen sense of design and bar for high quality data visuals to convey insights at scale.     Excellent problem structuring, identification and resolution; Ability to synthesize complex issues into easy to understand concepts     Critical thinking with analytical & product acumen; strong sense for business success     Experience structuring executive presentations with the appropriate level of storytelling, visuals and data analysis     A proactive, self-starter; someone who can roll up their sleeves and solve problems on their own initiative.           Bonus Points:       Work in a DTC (Direct to Consumer) experience or marketplace solutions would be a bonus - but not required.

column2: The Facility Performance Excellence (PE) Leader role is designed to coordinate and lead the facility implementation of the PE system which is a Project Readiness deployment into the ADM organization     Alignment with the global ADM PE philosophies while executing and sustaining the engagement is key to success     This position requires a leader that can facilitate and drive change in a fast paced and ever changing environment leveraging his/her strong interpersonal and influencing skills             Key to success in this position is the ability to work within and across the site as well as with external stakeholders creating value and buy-in as a key change facilitator for the Performance Excellence System facility deployment                         Your Responsibilities                       Align with strategic objectives for the Organization/Business Unit/Division/Functional                 Area/Plant and execute PE to accomplish them                 Understand tools and methodologies aligned to PE                 Coordinate local PE practitioner(s) agenda(s)                 Review of trip reports with the PE practitioner(s)                 Ensures visibility of cost and savings model ROI and the delivery of the expected savings at the Site Level.                 Leads the site Steering Team                 Coach and develop pillar teams                 Coordinate implementation gap analysis and manage execution of actions                 Work closely with PE practitioners to support implementation                 Responsible for successful implementation of PE on the site                        Your Profile                       Technical Training on the Job (OJT), some formal education helpful                 Performance Excellence System Pillar certification training provided                 Lean and Organizational Skills desirable but not required                 Exp. in Manufacturing/processing and/or Continuous Improvement                 Experienced and Respected leader                 Foundational experience in continuous improvement                 Interpersonal skills.                 Coaching and Facilitation skills                 Strong Leadership abilities.                 Project Management skills                 Cost management (eg savings)                 Senior leadership interaction work with all levels of the organization                               Future Perspective                       Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility in a modern work environment with flexible work time models                 Room for innovative thinking and growth with the possibility to manage your own career path.                 A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity.                 Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company.                  An attractive remuneration including a variety of social benefits like subsidized health & fitness offers.                 ADM is a company where managers and colleagues are encouraged to discuss and enable the flexibility that is needed to meet the demands of work and life.

column2: As Program Lead - Analytics Consulting, you will work on some of the latest applications of AI to solve complex business problems and demonstrate significant business value to one or more clients. In doing so, you will closely collaborate with a team of consultants, data scientists and data engineers.      You will lead the project team to design and deliver impactful solutions, drive adoption, and articulate value. On a typical workday, you could be doing one or more of the following:     Participate in client workshops to identify high impact problems that could be solved through AI based solutions     Translate business problems (sometimes ambiguous) into clear analytic problem statements.     Design a plan to develop and deploy advanced analytics solutions in collaboration with SMEs in Data Science & Engineering.     Own & drive execution of the plan by demonstrating techno-functional consulting & stakeholder management capabilities.     Measure and articulate how analytic results improve clients business & financial metrics.     Perform a role that involves a combination of hands-on contribution, customer engagement and team management.     Contribute to organization building through training, mentoring, and developing repeatable analytic approaches         Required         Experience level 6+ years.     Ability to discover patterns in data and deliver impactful insights in the context of client decision making     Knowledge of DS/ ML / AI techniques - when and why they are used and interpretation of results from a business viewpoint     In depth understanding of how analytics is used in decision making in one or more industries / functional areas     Ability to translate high level business problems to an analytics problem statement     Experience in scoping, development, validation & deployment of explanatory, predictive, and prescriptive analytic solutions     Experience in stakeholder management, driving project governance, and linking analytics to business value delivered     Hands-on experience in data handling using SQL and advanced analytics tools such as R and / or Python     Hands on experience in analysing and visualizing data using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Qlikview     Excellent presentation and communication skills     MBA from reputed institute preferred.

column2: Salesforce Industries goal is to deliver rapid, value-driven customer solutions for complex business problems. Our Salesforce Developers are key players in this objective, as they can demonstrate native Industry Cloud functionality to deliver customer requirements quickly with minimal customization.     you'll be responsible for turning the program design of our Solution Architects and Technical Architects into a configured solution that meets the customer s needs.     Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you'll be building out sophisticated dashboards and reports with CRMA.     you'll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.     you'll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.     you'll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing standard processes, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques.         Minimum Requirements:         10+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.     Experience in designing and building solutions in the CRMA dashboard and reports.     Experience in E2E Analytics delivery, including requirement gathering, planning, design, development, deployment, and customer interactions     Experience in data transformation using recipes and data flows. Crafting models using Einstein Discovery for predictive and prescriptive analytics.     Experience in building Salesforce flows for automating the next best action.     Proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise CRM implementations.     A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.     Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.     Vision to help us take our company to the next level.     Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Salesforce Platform Developer / Platform App Builder certification

column2: Job Description   Business Intelligence Professional Job Details   Job title Business Intelligence Professional    Why BT? Weve always been an organisation with purpose; to use the power of communications to make a better world. You can trace this back to our beginning as pioneers of the worlds first telecommunications company. At our heart were a technology company with research and innovation in our bones and a desire to be personal, simple, and brilliant for our customers - those are the values we live by whilst also creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed.   Our pursuit of progress over the past 180 years has established BT as a strong, successful brand, with huge scale capable of achieving great things. From supporting emergency services, hospitals, banks and keeping economies around the world online, safe and secure, to delivering large scale technology infrastructure like the creation of BT Sport.   Today in this fast changing, always on, digital world our purpose remains true. Yet the market conditions, regulation and competition we face are tougher than ever before. So if you have the drive, optimism and resilience to help propel us forward well offer unrivalled personal development, a wealth of opportunities to learn, experience new things and pursue new careers. If thats you and what you??e looking for, we?? love you to be part of our future.   Why Business Unit/Function We have around 1.2 million customers and serve over half the FTSE 350. Our customers range from big household names, government departments and public service organisations right through to small businesses and new start-ups. We cover both the communications and IT services markets. Overall we??e focused on four main product markets: Fixed Voice; Mobility; Fibre and connectivity; networked IT services provided over the biggest UK network in both fixed and mobile communications. We also provide network IT services to corporate and public sector organisations in the Republic of Ireland.   Our Wholesale business helps communications providers (CPs) and other organisations provide fixed or mobile phone services. Our ventures provide mass-market services like directory enquiries and payphones, and enterprise services including Fleet Solutions and BT Redcare. We also offer specialist enterprise services to our Internet of Things customers.   What I??l be doing ??your accountabilitiesSkills required for the job Specifically, this job is accountable for:-     Working with (often senior) stakeholders to design best-in-class reporting solutions using BT standard business intelligence software tools e.g. OBI, Qlik, Tableau Development and delivery of self-serve reporting solutions, ensuring highest quality and accuracy at all times  Taking the lead on ensuring personal skills are up to date and reflective of market trends in this specialised area Ensure all processes, data storage / handling and outputs comply with GDPR, and / or any other applicable compliance laws & regulations Manage BAU tasks including upkeep of existing reporting and improve with deploying available automation Story-telling with data:  Strong communication skills clearly translating complex concepts relating to data management, KPI, Visualization etc. that into meaningful business insights  Expert user of data visualisation tools primarily Qlik to help deliver key insights   Business acumen:  Knowledgeable in business strategy and the drivers of organisational performance, including people drivers of performance and financial literacy (e.g. business KPIs, business cases)   Technical :  Support with the build and maintenance of a central database for analytics and business intelligence Deep understanding of developing modern BI & Visualisation tools (and delivery of self-serve solutions in a business environment), including underlying data source handling and ETL development Must have a strong working knowledge of enterprise level databases, database architecture and SQL/BigQuery Cloud Solutions exposure, preferrabley GCP Story-telling with data - Strong communication skills clearly translating complex concepts relating to GBS and its stakeholders     3 Skills in demand most suitable to the job. Use data analytics : Uses knowledge and collection of data to support decisions. Delivers initiatives to improve data analytics in BT. Give specialised advice : Offers advice and makes recommendations based on expertise, suggesting solutions and improvements. Hold others to account : Understands expectations and manages themselves to high ethical and values standards. Will call out poor behaviour in others.   Able to manage expectations of several director level (n-3) stakeholders and effectively prioritise the workload / deliverables     BT ValuesExperience you would be expected to have Personal : Personal means we come across as human, and show our customers that we understand and care. Simple : Simple means we are straightforward, easy to deal with, and make complex things clear. Brilliant : Brilliant means we lead the way in creating new things, and whatever we do, we do it really well.  Preferred qualifications in BSc (Hons) in Digital and Technology Solutions, specialising in Data Analytics or BSc (Hons) in Computer Science or BSc (Hons) in Information and Communication Technology, B.tech in Computer Science, B.tech in Information and Technology   Preferred domain experience and expertise in the Business telecoms market, its products and systems, Financial Systems Key decisions If the job has key decision rights list these here (see RAPID guidance).   Recommends Prioritisation of workstack requirements and other deliverables
column11: QlikView, SQL, Qlik

column2: The candidate will work closely with other members of the SDA team, Technology Teams, Supply leadership and our regional and global stakeholders to solve critical business problems utilizing data and business process analysis skills.                        PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES / ACCOUNTABILITIES OF THE JOB:               General Responsibilities:           Understand critical datasets and systems utilized by PVH Supply Chain to build domain knowledge required for problem solving.     Responsible for creating and maintaining business reports and dashboards (both offline and utilizing data and analytics platform Lighthouse), as needed to support critical business needs.     Co-manage (dotted line) regional analysts embedded within the regional supply organizations.     Work with embedded analyst teams and supply chain stakeholders to identify Business Use Cases designed to provide answers and insights to the business.     Enable Skill Development and Knowledge Sharing for Embedded Analysts & Super Users     Help hire, Guide and Mentor resources in India s SDA analytics team.     Provide first level support of content within Lighthouse for the end users.     Additional focus on Advanced Analytics, Data Science use-cases, helping build for the future.     Help define the role of Databricks in building a strong data & analytics delivery team, establishing appropriate processes, use cases and training for enabling it within the team.               Strategy       :         Provide input into the multiyear vision and data strategy for PVH Supply Chain analytics.     Help with identification of Supply Chain use cases for analytics within Lighthouse driving to best-in-class analytics to enable a data-driven, exception-based supply chain.     Work Closely with Product Manager/ Business Analytics and business teams to monitor and track D&A s contribution to PVH s strategic priorities.     Provides management visibility into data-driven insights that inform the business s strategic direction and KPI s.     Supports business executives and departmental leaders in making strategic, data-driven decisions, regarding new products, additional use cases, customer segments, investments, among other subjects.     Contributes insights for the continuous improvement of the overall analytics environment.               Collaboration     :       Partner with other SDA leaders to influence data and analytics capability roadmap, looking at flow of data end to end.     Collaborate with supply chain business partners to define requirements for globally aligned analytics deliverables     Collaborative Analysis and Problem Solving with Regional Stakeholders by creating reports (both offline and utilizing data and analytics platform Lighthouse).     Collaborate across brands and regions to standardize and simplify toolset, data hierarchy, methodologies, metrics, and reporting.     Partner with brands and regions to model out and quantify value of initiatives.     Work closely with the Business Analyst to help gather and document all functional and technical requirements of all business use cases   .       Provide inputs into prioritization of Business Use Cases and the backlog for the development teams.     Work closely with Senior Manager of Data Quality on the Data Quality and Governance activities including clean data practices and process improvement and alignment across all regions   .                     Analytics:           Prioritize the backlog of analytics capabilities working with key business leaders.     Demonstrated skill using analytics for supply chain data assessment.     Analyze & report internal and external data relevant to PVH Supply Chain.     Understand evolving internal supply chain systems landscape and architecture.     Perform variety analyses, hypothesis testing, and causal analyses to statistically assess data trends and communicate the insights.     Collaborate with a wide variety of stakeholders - US SDA counterparts, Vendor Management Team, Brands and Businesses, IT, CR Team & external service partners to leverage appropriate data sources for analysis and reporting.               Knowledge and Opportunity       :         Stays informed, keeping up with the latest industry trends and best practices.     Participates in data conferences, workshops, seminars, and so forth.     Brings new ideas and techniques to the team to inform the analytics roadmap and deliverables.                     SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:              Direct:    (potential to grow to 1-3 Data Analysts/Sr Data Analysts)       Provide leadership for a team of Analysts performing data analysis, building reports, dashboards and metrics both offline and within the Lighthouse analytics platform.      Set priorities, manage workload, grow their analytic skills and business data knowledge.      Manage timelines and schedules for their work, removing roadblocks and escalating issues as needed to ensure work is completed on time with a high level of quality.     Provide status updates on team s deliverables to broader project team.                     DECISION MAKING:             Decides priority and timing as well as resource allocation for all ad-hoc requests from the business.     Identifies best solution to complex issues escalated from the team.     Elevate issues to the appropriate channels.     Identifies best solution for satisfying business analytics use cases.                 RESOURCEFULNESS/CREATIVITY          Self-starter with a curious mind who knows good ideas can come from anywhere.     Proactively seeks out resources needed to be successful.     Ability to build good working relationships; collaborates toward deadlines and deliverables.      Uses creativity in communication to clearly articulate written and visual messages; includes creative usage of Power Point to convey messages.     Trusted and respected resource as the connector to keep project teams on track.     Ability to engage externally with industry groups and partners and represent PVH.                 ENVIRONMENT:          Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented setting with peers who are energized by building the future together.     Ability to work on multiple initiatives and embrace change swiftly to drive transformational value.     Ability to interface with stakeholders across multiple countries and cultures.                 CORE VALUES         Embrace PVHs core values: Individuality, Partnership, Passion, Integrity, and Accountability.                 QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE         Experience   : 7 to 10 years of relevant experience in a global data & analytics environment.           Education   :       Bachelor s degree in Analytics, Management Information Systems, Engineering, Science or similar quantitative field required, Master s degree a plus     Experience working in an Agile environment.             Technical Skills (Must have)         Prior experience / exposure to applying analytics in a Supply Chain environment     Strong ability to translate business use cases and strategic priorities into clear analytics requirements     Strong ability to create clear, intuitive, and meaningful data visualizations and BI deliverables.     Strong expertise with MS Excel (Pivot tables, look-up formulas, handling large volumes of data)     Strong expertise with data mining using SQL      Ability to query and manipulate datasets using SQL.     Ability to write complex queries to model business rules.     Solid understanding of Dimensional data models.         Intermediate to Strong expertise in leveraging Statistical techniques in analysis.      Experience with Descriptive statistics like - hypothesis testing, Correlation analysis etc.          Experience with Predictive Modelling (Linear / Logistic Regression) and Time Series Forecasting.     Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies such as Scrum.     Strong skills building analytics in MicroStrategy or similar tool     Exposure to DataBricks.                 Technical Skills (Good to have)         Exposure to automating Excel tasks using VBA macros will be a plus.     Prior experience / exposure to applying analytics in Fashion / Apparel.             Other SKILLS         Strong expertise in using PowerPoint to present analysis findings and provide insights.     Exposure to creating senior leadership level executive presentations.     Excellent customer-facing oral and written communication skills.     Attention to detail.     Team building.     Data Analysis.

column2: Project Role : Business Architect Project Role Description : Define opportunities to create tangible business value for the client by leading current state assessments and identifying high level customer requirements, defining the business solutions and structures needed to realize these opportunities, and developing business case to achieve the vision.  Must have skills : Business Requirements Analysis Good to have skills : NA Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : B tech Summary :As a Business Architect, you will be responsible for leading current state assessments and identifying high-level customer requirements, defining the business solutions and structures needed to realize these opportunities, and developing a business case to achieve the vision. Your typical day will involve analyzing business requirements, identifying opportunities to create tangible business value for the client, and developing business solutions and structures.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead current state assessments and identify high-level customer requirements. Define the business solutions and structures needed to realize opportunities. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Business Requirements Analysis. Good To Have Skills:Business Process Modeling, Business Process Design, Business Process Improvement. Strong understanding of business analysis methodologies and tools. Experience in developing business cases and business solutions. Experience in leading current state assessments and identifying high-level customer requirements. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in Business Requirements Analysis. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in business administration, computer science, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful business-driven solutions. This position is based at our Pune office. Qualification B tech

column2: Skill required:  Property & Casualty - Catastrophe Risk Management Designation:  Analytics and Modeling Senior Analyst Qualifications: BE/BTech/BCom  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? We help insurers redefine their customer experience while accelerating their innovation agenda to drive sustainable growth by transforming to an intelligent operating model. Intelligent Insurance Operations combines our advisory, technology, and operations expertise, global scale, and robust ecosystem with our insurance transformation capabilities. It is structured to address the scope and complexity of the ever-changing insurance environment and offers a flexible operating model that can meet the unique needs of each market segment.Claims settlements related any client property they own or any accidentsCatastrophe Risk Management refers to the process of guiding insurers how to manage risk aggregations, deploy capital, and price insurance coverage by using computer assisted calculations to estimate the losses that could be sustained due to a catastrophic event such as a hurricane or earthquake. What are we looking for? Collaboration and interpersonal skills Problem-solving skills Strong analytical skills Written and verbal communication Agility for quick learning Individual with a bachelor degree in quantitative field (Engineering/Science/Economics/Statistics) Must demonstrate interpersonal and communication skills along with analytical and logical approach Prior experience (5-8 years) in insurance/account modeling/financial modeling/specialized industry (Energy/Aerospace/Marine/Construction) is must Candidate must be self motivated and willing to learn more about insurance, reinsurance, risk management, project management, natural catastrophe, business dependencies  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts
column11: risk management, project management, reinsurance, quantitative, financial modelling, financial analysis, data analysis, team management, presentation skills, business analysis, strategic thinking, underwriting, general insurance, qualitative research, statistics

column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making that will allow us to tackle some of the world s greatest health threats.      Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management.      Deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.      In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. As we endeavour, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of    Senior Analyst - Advanced Analytics       We are looking for a team member to support our analytics team based out of US. Robust analytics is a priority for our businesses, as the product potential has major implications to a wide range of disciplines.      It is essential to have someone who understands and aspires to implement innovative analytics techniques to drive our insights generation across different franchises.      The core of the role is to be a trusted business partner having deep data mining expertise and a strong advanced analytical skill set.      The role will partner with the GBU Business Transformation team to support with advanced data analysis, Model building, Promo-Mix modelling, Insights, generating reports, and presenting the insights or output to senior Leadership                People   :     Maintain effective relationship with the end stakeholders within the allocated GBU and tasks with an end objective to develop model and analysis as per requirement.     Collaborate with global stakeholders for project planning and setting up the timelines and maintaining budget     Performance indicators: Feedback from (end stakeholders) on overall satisfaction           Weightage:             Performance   :     Hands on modelling in support of GenMed, Specialty Care, CHC, Pasteur resource allocation work     Evaluates the effectiveness of various promotion and marketing programs leveraging secondary data sources     Marketing mix model / Promotion response model / ROI analysis     Impact of channel dynamics: Field Force/Multi-Channel Modelling (New Commercial Model)     Optimizes promotion resource allocation     Scenario-Based Simulation     Other analyses include customer segmentation, market performance analysis/trend Break detection, pricing analysis, web-analytic tools     Develops new methodologies/software solutions     Creates, maintains, updates, and evolves Marketing Mix Models Globally     Responsible for consistent metrics as inputs and outputs of the models     Quantitative Strategy Consultant partner with a broad range of internal cross-BU client teams across regions to deliver and advise seamless solutions across the most specific marketing and sales issues facing a client     Engage with lead Global Service Hub lead to formulate and apply state-of-the-art management science approaches (Resource Allocation) to define the need from the clients     Integrate output from the Global Analytic CoE to support Regional Strategy issues working with the Global Service Hub lead     Subject Matter Expert in Marketing Mix implementation     Strong healthcare industry knowledge and experience     Ability to assimilate multiple sources of information into actionable insight for business issues     Strong working knowledge of relevant data sources and ability to search for new and informative sources.                   Performance indicators   : Adherence to timeline, quality target       Weightage   : 50%               Process   :     Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the medical/ field writing group, including scientific documents and clinical/medical reports     Contribute to overall quality enhancement by ensuring high scientific standards for the output produced by the medical/ field writing group; and     Secure adherence to compliance procedures and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with all applicable standards     Refresh report on frequency/cycle basis (weekly / monthly / quarterly / annually) ,  along with QC checks for each refresh     Use latest tools / technologies / methodologies and partner with internal teams to provide support on all sort of regular and adhoc business analytics activities like build, maintenance, and enhancements of such systems     Ability to work cross-functionally, gather requirements, analyse data, and generate insights and reports that can be used by the GBU     Work collaboratively with the stakeholder teams to prioritize work and deliver on time-sensitive requests     Be able to provide and defend gathered intelligence, methodology, content, and conclusions to the global leadership in a clear, concise format       Performance indicators   : Feedback from stakeholders on satisfaction with deliverables Adherence to plan/calendar       Weightage   : 25%                       About you             Experience   :     4+ years of experience in a Pharma and/or CPG Data Science/Management Science setting.     Heavy Quantitative Analysis - State-of-the-Art Quantitative Skills     Economics Background a plus (i.e., Phd preferred)     Niche Modeling Consulting Background     Experience in Pharma Sales and Marketing Strategy Modeling     Advanced Econometric/Statistical modeling skills     Experience with SAS programming     Proficient in R and/or Python programming     Strong work ethic     Ability to work under pressure     Manage project, work with statistical consultants     Interact with quantitative business analysts         Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques.     People management experience by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training associates; conflicts or complaints resolving ability from stakeholders and associates.     Supervising project activities and ensuring it is properly provisioned and staffed

column2: Create objective and robust forecast models - generating patients on therapy, demand units, and revenue - taking into consideration key data, insights, trends, and assumptions around patient flow, market dynamics, competitive landscape, payer mix, etc.         Assess, recommend, and execute on the optimal method(s) for forecasting, considering the context of the forecast, therapeutic/disease area, availability of data, the degree of accuracy required for the process/decision-making, and the required timeline     Contribute to evolving our offerings and improving efficiency of repeated /routine processes through standardization/ automation of various offerings, models, and processes     Evaluate existing forecast models to identify and prioritize areas for improvement to drive better efficiency, flexibility, and results over time     Refresh forecast model assumptions and as needed structure / functionality with the latest insights as they become available     Understand the spectrum of internal/external data that is available to inform forecasts and utilize a broad range of techniques to access and synthesize that data     Conduct sensitivity analyses and evaluate alternative scenarios to assist in risk management, asset valuation, and informed decision-making     Support presentation of forecasts and insights by various communication channels and methods: discussion and review, slide generation, submission into internal systems, and reporting dashboards     Create simple or cloud-based dashboards to synthesize and visualize key information enabling informed business decisions     Support NPP Forecasting colleagues with analytical research needs. Examples could include activities as diverse as secondary research, assisting with the development or interpretation of primary market research.     Capability in applying deeper technical skills and knowledge that is shared across the functional area (e.g., deep knowledge of key data sets, modeling capabilities, etc.)     Understand the external environment for context on the latest therapeutic area research and clinical development, as well as competitive landscape to inform forecast dynamics             Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience               Advanced degree in areas such as Statistics/Decision Sciences/Engineering/Business (e.g., PhD / MBA / Masters); 7+ years of experience in pharmaceutical product forecasting. Experience on Specialty brands preferred. In-depth knowledge of forecasting techniques and use of different forecast models and approaches   .       Expert knowledge of Excel         Hands on experience on with multiple forecasting techniques and methodologies (time series, Monte Carlo, what-if scenarios, range forecasting, etc.)         Experience with sources and analysis of life sciences data (Claims, IQVIA, Symphony, Specialty Pharmacy, etc.)         Proficiency in one or more programming languages used for data query and analysis (VBA, SQL, Python, R, SAS, etc.)         Strong skill in synthesizing forecast data into presentations that can be understood by stakeholders across the organization, including those who are unfamiliar (the so-what )         Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation         Ability to synthesize complex information into clear and actionable insights         Proven ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across diverse levels and stakeholder in different functional roles in a matrixed global organization         Strong analytical skills; an aptitude for problem solving and strategic thinking         Ability to manage ambiguous environments, and to adapt to changing needs of business               Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Experience               Experience working with colleagues in other geographies (United States, Europe, APAC)         Solid understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing supply, and marketing functions         Experience using artificial intelligence and/or machine learning to analyze complex data sets in a forecasting capacity       Experience using TM1 Planning Analytics reports and/or familiarity with Snowflake     Understanding of data governance and data quality tools       Familiarity with data visualization and business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau)          Experience using analytical platforms (e.g., Databricks, Jupyter Notebook, SQL developers, etc.)         Familiar with interpreting and/or designing market research studies

column2: Pricing and Promo Analytics Analyst plays a crucial role in our organization, serving as the analyst responsible for various aspects of price elasticity analysis.          This role involves tasks related to understanding and assessing price sensitivity, analyzing customer behavior, and supporting pricing strategies.            The key responsibilities of the Pricing Analyst include:            Conducting market research and other data analysis to understand and gather key price drivers.          Conducting Price elasticity, Pricing Conjoint and Perceived Value study to provide insights into consumer reactions to pricing changes          Gaining in-depth understanding of Shopper Behavior for every channel in the region          Standardizing and simplifying our pricing models and methodologies to enhance efficiency.          Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure pricing strategies align with our goals          Utilizing data-driven insights to improve the overall shopper and user experiences related to pricing          Contributing to the long-term pricing strategy of the organization and assisting in the development of new pricing approaches          Pricing and Promo Analytics Analyst leverages analytical skills and tools to support our pricing strategies designed to increase our market share and profitability while enhancing the shopper experience.            Responsibilities              Develop advanced analytics solutions using Machine Learning and statistics to inform pricing and pack architecture decisions and support our long-term strategy.          Utilize expertise to build Price Elasticity Models for Promoted and Non-promoted SKUs.          Develop scenarios of pricing and pack architecture using Conjoint study.          Build simulations on Pricing and Promotions, support in building Promo calendar.          Identify perceived Value of all SKUs in PepsiCo portfolio and how it compares against competition.          Support the development of a clear Channel and Customer Pricing Strategy.          Provide recommendations for optimizing the commercial strategy and game plan to maximize the product mix.          Determine annual pricing rates based on relevant external and competitive benchmarks.          Define promotional guidelines and optimal offers, identify promotion frequency to deliver targeted Consumer Value, Effectiveness, and Profitability.          Ensure the delivery of accurate and timely data in accordance with agreed service level agreements (SLA).          Collaborate with multiple functions to gather insights for action-oriented cause of change analysis.          Prioritize speed of execution and quality of service delivery over simply meeting SLAs          Recognize opportunities for improvement in the delivery of work and take proactive action to enhance processes and outcomes.            Qualifications              6 -9 years of strong experience in Data Analytics; Revenue Management or Sales experience is a plus.          Experience in managing complex, incomplete, and inconsistent datasets.          Deep grounding in analytical logic, enabling the translation of complex data into powerful insights.          Ability to source data from internal and external contacts without detailed process or guidance.          Proficiency in using PowerPoint to create visually compelling presentations that resonate with senior audiences.          Familiarity with syndicated data sets (Nielsen/IRI), price and promotion models, trade system data, and financial data is a plus.          Experience in top-tier consulting or Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) companies is a plus.          Exceptional analytical skills with advanced proficiency in MS Excel (VBA and Macros) and Alteryx.          Working proficiency in Python or R Language (preferred)          Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.          Ability to build Machine Learning algorithms on forecasting is a plus.          Bachelors degree in engineering or statistics, Masters degree is a plus.          If the candidate is from Commerce stream, demonstrated acumen on Data Science.          Willingness and ability to quickly learn and utilize PepsiCo software systems.          Exceptional time management skills, including ability to set priorities and plan effectively

column1: Section Lead - Data & Analytics - Data Engineering
column2: The Data Analytics Chapter will build excellence and mastery in next generation data and analytics capabilities, including but not limited to Data Science, Data Engineering, Analytics and Data Management       Expertise from the Chapter will be embedded into initiatives across multiple business and foundational domains to drive value generation and promote cross-functional analysis and collaboration     In addition to partnering with teams across the business to develop solutions, scale and automate data pipelines, Chapter members are uniquely placed to connect the dots across initiatives, promote information sharing across domains and recommend re-use of data, analytics and solutions wherever possible       Data Engineering encompasses the capabilities involved in designing, building, operationalising, securing and monitoring data pipelines to be used for analytics and data science purposes     Data engineering practitioners possess a wide variety of capabilities such as being able to ingest, transform and load data from multiple data sources, build automated data pipelines to manage and process data at scale, design and model data, index and process contents for search, leverage DevOps capabilities to design and build frameworks to automate build and deployment of data and machine learning products on premise and/or in the cloud column1: Azure Data Engineer / Sr. BI and Analytics developer
column2: Job Title: Azure Data Engineer / Sr. BI and Analytics developer Experience: 6+ Years Location: Hyderabad Working Hours: 12.00pm to 9.00pm Key Responsibilities:   Ensure that Health and Safety is the number one goal by following policies, processes, and always acting in a safe manner. Design, develop, and maintain business intelligence reports and dashboards using PowerBI. Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets. Analyze complex data sets and convert them into information that can help drive business decisions. Leverage Azure-based solutions for data storage and analysis, such as Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and develop business intelligence solutions accordingly. Ensure the accuracy of the data presented in BI reports and dashboards. Design data storage systems that scale, perform, and are economical enough to satisfy the organizations requirements. Implement and optimize data retrieval for Power BI solutions. Develop and implement data integration processes, frequently using Azure Data Factory, to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into Azure data warehouses or data lakes. Required Skills   A bachelors degree with      significant relevant experience would suffice. A masters degree in computer      science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus. 6+ years of proven experience as a BI Developer. Background in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining. In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework. Strong experience using Microsoft Power BI. Strong experience in SQL, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) along with knowledge in NoSQL databases and Data Fabric architectures. Knowledge of Microsoft Azures data services like Azure Data Factory. Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative. Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude. Strong analytical skills, with the ability to      collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders. Power BI certification will be preferred.

column2: Human Resources  are at the heart of Accenture, unleashing the power of talent in everything we do. We take pride in making a real impact on the careers and well-being of our people, and ensuring Accenture is one of the most inclusive and diverse organizations in the world. Join us as we pursue our ultimate ambitionto be the best place for the most highly specialized talent on the planet. Corporate Functions including Human Resources, Finance, Legal, Marketing and Communications, and Workplace Solutions--offers the essential expertise that enables our more than 394,000 employees to deliver high performance to our clients. Be the engine that powers Accenture, a $31 billion company that provides consulting and outsourcing services to more than 40 industries--including 94 of the Fortune 100, and governments around the world. Ability to understand complex real world business problems, often in ambiguous scenario, and transform into workable solutions. PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS  (BULLETS) Desired Certified Scrum Master. column2: About the job TekLink (an HGS Company) has been assisting global customers since 2003 bringing data to life as their Trusted Analytics and Planning partner. At TekLink, we have over 20 years of experience implementing analytics and planning solutions. We serve customers across multiple industries including, Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), Manufacturing, Technology, Higher Education and Public institutions. Majority of our customers are renowned Fortune 500 organizations. What are we looking for: Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with the data engineering team to extract and manipulate data from Snowflake databases. Design and develop data models and views to support business requirements. Create visually appealing and interactive Tableau dashboards and reports. Work closely with the business team to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable insights. Conduct dashboard wireframing exercises to conceptualize user-friendly interfaces. Optimize dashboard performance and ensure data accuracy and integrity. Provide technical expertise and guidance to junior team members as needed. Stay updated on the latest Tableau features and best practices. Qualifications: 10 + years of experience in Tableau development, with a strong portfolio showcasing Tableau dashboards and reports. Proficiency in connecting data from Snowflake databases and working with complex datasets. Solid understanding of data modelling principles and experience in designing efficient data models. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience in conducting dashboard wireframing exercises is a plus. Strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset. Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on the latest Tableau features and best practices. Working at TekLink At TekLink our employees get an open and collaborative environment and gain experience working for customers in various industries while solving complex business problems. They get support to learn new technologies as well as to enhance existing skills to further their career growth. We Offer Very competitive remuneration Excellent Benefits including  Shift allowance, Health, accidental and Life coverage. Excellent performance based annual increments. Fast paced growth opportunities International work experience Opportunity to participate in various sports and CSR activities Interested candidates please share your profile to rajesh.bojja@teklink.com

column2: This position is remote, where you have the option to work from home. On occasion we may request for you to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events. To ensure the safety of our colleagues and communities, we require employees who come together in-person to be fully vaccinated. Were proud to offer you choice and flexibility.  Organizational Overview:  Synchrony's Risk Team is a dynamic and innovative team dedicated to provide oversight as 2nd Line of Defense. Risk Team oversees and manages the Risk Program in order to support the business in anticipating and addressing risks, issues and challenges. Results are consistent with the respective strategic uses and complying with related Overall Risk / Risk Testing policies, standards, procedures as well as regulations. This role is aligned to Enterprise Risk- Risk Testing analytics & requires high level of expertise with data & analytics - minimal technical supervision to effectively contribute to projects.  Role Summary/Purpose:  The selected candidate will be a L10-AVP on the Risk Analytics Team in India, that rolls up into Synchrony Financial India. The candidate will be responsible for using analytics and innovation to develop data driven solutions that yield efficiencies and enhanced effectiveness across the organization. This role will also be responsible for becoming a functional expert, while collaborating with Synchrony Process Owners including VP and SVP levels. The candidate is also responsible for building partnerships with various US stakeholders.  Key Responsibilities:   Develop, lead, collaborate, manage, communicate, and influence data driven solutions and results primarily with the Risk Testing Team, but may support the other analytics pillars that include Compliance, Operational Risk and First Line Process Oversight.   Identify how to measure control design and effectiveness, and review CTCs; interpret its meaning and its analytics scope by leveraging internal Data warehouses   Ability to work independently and able to perform technical code validations periodically   Collaborate and engage with all levels of management including Senior Leaders across all sites to drive analytics-based process improvements, insights, thought leadership and actions.   Become a data SME and an Analytics Athlete that includes end-to-end functional learning, leveraging most data warehouses and applying the necessary tools for each solution that includes visualization, machine learning, speech analytics and data mining.  Innovate data driven solutions independently with enterprise-wide customers across both the first and second lines of defense by leveraging the latest analytical tools and technologies.   Problem solving through analytics to bring value-add efficiencies to our customers that include solutions involving automation, visualization, analytical insight, and machine learning.   Effectively engage with customers to de-risk Synchrony through analytical oversight and review of end-to-end processes utilizing data and effective challenge to ensure key objectives and risks are accurately connected in a meaningful manner.   Engage in storytelling with the data output that will create a comprehensive view on what the data means including identified actions.   Interact and present key data driven updates and initiatives to the stakeholders and regulators.   Participate in the Risk Engagement Strategy process that will develop and drive improvements across the Risk Team   Drive projects with minimum guidance  Required Skills/Knowledge:   Bachelors degree with minimum of 4+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry or in lieu of Degree, 6+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry.   4 years of Hands on working knowledge of SAS, SQL , Tableau   Ability to interact with all levels of Leadership and collaborative across teams and functions   Strong written/oral communication skills.   Proven ability to deliver Analytical solutions for Business problems  Desired Skills/Knowledge:   Ability to validate first line control framework as part of the Risk testing.   Knowledge of Credit Card/Consumer Finance products and Risk analytics experience   Ability to work on simultaneous multiple projects, organize work flow, and prioritize work assignments while being in different time zones.   Experience in people and project management, including demonstrated ability to develop actionable plan to meet high level objectives, strong execution, and timeline sensitive deliverables.   Experience of working in a matrix organization with multiple stakeholders.   Sharp focus on accuracy with extreme attention to detail.  Eligibility Criteria:  Bachelors degree with minimum of 4+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry or in lieu of Degree, 6+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry.  Work Timings: 1:00 PM IST to 11:00 PM IST

column2: Organizational Overview:  Credit Team decisions credit actions across the lifecycle of a customer  from acquisition to account management to collections and recover  we work towards managing credit and fraud losses and elevating customer experience through powerful and proprietary insights on customer risk and credit behaviours. The actionable insights are driven by access to numerous alternative data sources, new age technologies, focused strategies, emerging algorithms, and predictive precision. Spread across 10 pillars the credit team in India caters to the entire gamut of decision sciences, from data management to model development to strategy design, and bringing it all to life through technology, and managing within the guardrails of our regulatory requirements. As part of the team, you will have access to some unique product propositions, functional and leadership training, interaction with executive leadership team and a myriad of diverse perspectives.  Role Summary/Purpose:  The VP Fraud Strategy Manager will set and drive transactional fraud loss mitigating strategies that meet SYFs strategic vision of leveraging existing and incremental data and advanced analytics to improve the customer experience and improve P & L performance for several portfolios.  Key Responsibilities:   Assume ownership of fraud strategy development efforts certain portfolios   Utilize internal and external data/tools to perform trend identification and work directly with other fraud team members and business leaders to design compensating controls.   Manage transactional fraud strategies in both batch and real-time environments.   Partner with advanced modeling teams to drive targeting/treatment solutions that meet business objectives   Drive enhancements to differentiate the core fraud loss mitigation strategies across strategic portfolio segments that leverages the unique aspects of those segments.   Partner with strategy optimization role to ensure strategy actions meet SYF financial commitments and risk appetite   Work with finance team/PCMs team to ensure strategies are driving the desired P & L impacts   Strategy owners are ultimately responsible for the ongoing effectiveness and monitoring of their strategies. As such this role will develop the framework for how we monitor, measure and report the results of our strategies to business   Provide swift actions to combat immediate fraud attacks, and proactively prevent future such attacks  Required Skills/Knowledge:   Bachelors/Masters degree with 8+ years of experience in building analytically derived strategies with in Credit, Marketing, Risk or Collections in Financial services, or in lieu of a degree 10+ years of experience.   Minimum 3 years experience in Authorization Strategy or Fraud Strategy Development or Implementation   Minimum 3 years??Project Management experience   Minimum 2 years??experience with operational and regulatory risk, and governance   Demonstrated expert proficiency with SAS and/or SQL programming especially Data Extractions and ensuring data quality   Expert level proficiency with Excel  Desired Skills/Knowledge:   Degree in Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Business, or Statistics strongly preferred.   Master's Degree desired   Excellent communication skills and experience with interacting successfully at all levels within the RCF organization.   Outstanding collaborative and team management style.   Ability to multitask and perform in a fast paced environment   Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills.   International fraud/consumer finance experience a plus.   Experience with CDCI, RAMS, PDR and CLBP2 database a plus   Proven ability to work with data sources, data warehouses and database tools.   Proven ability to successfully manage and implement projects on time & on budget.   Proven ability to communicate with all levels of employees, management and clients.  Eligibility Criteria:  Bachelor??/Master?? degree with 8+ years of experience in building analytically derived strategies with in Credit, Marketing, Risk or Collections in Financial services, or in lieu of a degree 10+ years of experience Work Timings:  This role qualifies for Enhanced Flexibility and Choice offered in Synchrony India and will require the incumbent to be available between 06:00 AM Eastern Time ??11:30 AM Eastern Time (timings are anchored to US Eastern hours and will adjust twice a year locally). This window is for meetings with India and US teams. The remaining hours will be flexible for the employee to choose. Exceptions may apply periodically due to business needs.

column2: Dear Aspirants, We are looking for an experienced  Reporting Manager-DART  to shape our organisations long-term strategy and develop measures that realise our business objectives. Interested applicants can share their update CV's to   hemabindu.myllipilli@patracorp.com Job Location :  Remote however Ability to travel to Patra offices in India (Vizag, Coimbatore, Raipur & Warangal) Flexible for rotational shifts Mode of Work : Remote + travelling Overview : If youre good at what you do, work anywhere. If youre the best at what you do, come work at Patra!  We are leading the way in providing Technology-Enabled Services to the insurance industry. We have a culture first approach that puts inclusivity and work/life balance at the forefront. We do this 100% remotely, always have. Responsibilities: About this job As part of the Data, Analytics & Reporting Team (DART), the Reporting Manager will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of the reporting team, ensuring they deliver exceptional service to our internal business partners while meeting key performance indicators (KPIs). Core Duties : Administrative Recruit, hire and onboard staff. Manage team schedules and ensure adequate staffing levels to meet business demands. Track individual and team performance metrics and report key data to management. Develop and maintain clear and concise documentation for support processes. Perform other administrative tasks as needed. Team leadership Provide direct supervision and coaching to technicians across multiple shifts. Conduct performance reviews, set goals, and provide ongoing feedback for development. Identify training needs for the team and coordinate training initiatives. Address performance concerns and implement corrective action plans as needed. Foster a positive and collaborative work environment. Technical Support Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in technical support. Maintain a strong understanding of Patra's systems, clients and services. Prioritize and assign incoming support tickets, ensuring timely resolution. Assist technicians with complex technical issues and escalate critical problems to the appropriate teams. Create and maintain documentation for standard operating procedures (SOPs), knowledge base and troubleshooting guides. Quality Establish and maintain high-quality standards for service delivery. Ensure the quality of all support technicians work product and interactions. Monitor adherence to Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for service requests. Generate reports to analyze team performance, identify trends, and measure satisfaction. Identify areas for improvement in processes and workflows. Qualifications: Minimum Requirements - Education & Experience Minimum 3 years of experience in a technical support role. Proven experience in managing and coaching a team in a 24/7 operational environment. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills. Strong organizational and time management skills. Proficient in documentation tools and knowledge of ticketing systems a plus. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Strong understanding of technical support best practices and methodologies. P&C insurance and consulting experience preferred. Knowledge of Agile (scrum) methodology a plus.

column2: Job Description: The Qlik Developer will be responsible for working with fund accounting professionals and technology organizations to build, maintain and complete customized reporting statements. The position requires at least 2 years of experience using QlikView version 11 or higher with proven experience in the following areas: QlikView Dashboard Design & Development Good knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and Dimensional Modeling Working with large data sets & Experience with complex data models involving more than 10 tables Integrating data from multiple data sources into a QlikView Data Model, Social Media content, API extensions, etc. Use of complex QlikView functions and developing most optimal scripts for a given solution Optimization of Dimensional data model for performance Primary Responsibilities Will Include: The successful candidate will be using technologies such as QlikView and NPrinting to create and provide the business areas with new reporting and dashboard applications, to enable better decision making Responsible for working with stakeholders, business users and technical teams to identify use cases; organize requirement gathering sessions with stakeholders, capture and translate business requirements into system & functional requirements Collaborate with business leads to create prototypes and conduct Proof of Concepts Develop and conduct analysis on key business metrics and answer on-going ad-hoc questions Responsible for installing, configuring & maintaining the QlikView environment (QlikView, Qlik Sense, Publisher, NPrinting) Create and maintain complex QlikView applications. Use advanced functions as needed (I.e. - set analysis, section access, alternate states, loop and reduce, etc.) Define and extract data from a variety of data sources (SQL Server, Oracle, Excel Files, Hive, etc.). Architect data structures and processes to standardize, distribute and provide access to information to all users in the organization Work with the Business Intelligence Architect, IT Operations, and Information Security on designing and implementing the appropriate security model Mentor and train other Data Services team members and power users on best practices on - QVD generation, Publishing, developing QlikView applications. Additionally define best practices for data visualization and NPrinting reports Implement procedures around migration, scheduling and distribution of applications Help design support procedures and train IT support on best practices; provide Level 3 end-user support for all QlikView related issue Follows the SDLC methodology Job Requirements, Skills, Education and Experience: Bachelors degree in Computer Science Extensive experience across all stages of the QlikView lifecycle (sourcing data, QVD generation, dashboard design) Experience with complex QlikView functions set analysis, alternate states, advanced scripting, etc. Job Requirements, Skills, Education and Experience continued: Experience with section access and implementing data level security Distributed QlikView applications and reports using Publisher and NPrinting Knowledge of QlikView distributed architecture and experience with administering and governing QlikView environments Knowledge of SDLC and familiarity with Agile software development concepts Prior experience with process improvement a plus Ability to own initiatives and work in a matrix-based organization Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills Superior analytical and problem-solving skills

The incumbent will be instrumental in providing actionable data driven insights, leading consultative engagements and driving thought leadership is building/ uplifting our international matching algorithms, closely partnering with capability owners on testing and continuously improving existing processes.              If you crave dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and collaborative environment; if you have a passion for solving business problems & client difficulties; if you love story telling with data this opportunity is for you                 How will you make an impact in this role                 Lead a team of 3 - 4 analysts to successfully deliver reporting, analytics, insights, and consultative engagement with account development and B2B Advisory teams. Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and encourage partners and stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment.             Background in B2B: Understanding of B2B payments; knowledge of procurement and/ or accounts payable data strongly preferred.             Bachelors degree required, masters degree or equivalent experience in finance, statistics, business, or related field preferred. column2: You are responsible to collaborate with US business partners from the Enterprise Data Office group, focusing on patients & healthcare claims data operations. You will engage with data vendors, operations teams, and therapy area experts, exploring data sources, providing recommendations for utilization, onboarding new data, managing contracts, identifying data quality issues, and proposing solutions for process gaps         You have to lead complex initiatives and operations in the areas of Patients / Healthcare Claims, especially related to data evaluation, championing use cases, and ensuring data quality. Lead discussions, act as a thought partner, coordinate with internal teams, offer subject matter expertise to jointly drive various initiatives for business partners, and address user queries         You are responsible to engage with data vendors, operations teams, and therapy area experts, exploring data sources, providing recommendations for utilization, and managing data contracts for onboarding data while ensuring data quality. Make recommendations to data vendors regarding any limitations with the data sources and convey enhancement needs         Understand stakeholder needs, prioritize and manage day-to-day tasks accordingly, including interacting with therapy area experts, Patients & Healthcare Claims data experts, gathering requirements, and coordinating with the internal team to deliver them         Develop presentations to communicate key insights and recommendations to stakeholders, attend meetings with teams across different time zones, and ensure the smooth delivery of analytical and operations-related requests for business partners               Who you are           You hold a bachelor s degree in Technology / Engineering (Computer Science preferred) with 5-8 years of overall experience in analytics/data consulting, with a focus on Pharma/Healthcare engagements for 2-5 years         Expertise in exploratory analysis, research, and delivering complex business and data solutions         You should have strong background in Pharma data management, data contracts, process improvement, and data analysis. column2: Best In-class Benefits     Inclusive Leadership     Reimagining Healthcare     Competitive Pay     Supportive Reporting Relation                     We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) and Data Engineer to join our team     In this role, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure required to support our machine learning models and data pipelines     You will work closely with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and software engineers to ensure that our models can be deployed and scaled efficiently and reliably, and that our data pipelines are reliable, scalable, and secure                 Responsibilities:         Design, build, and maintain the infrastructure required to support our machine learning models and data pipelines     Collaborate with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and software engineers to ensure that our models can be deployed and scaled efficiently and reliably     Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for machine learning models and data pipelines     Automate the deployment and scaling of machine learning models and data pipelines in production environments     Ensure that our machine learning models and data pipelines are secure and comply with regulatory requirements     Build and maintain data pipelines, including data ingestion, data transformation, and data storage     Monitor the performance of our machine learning models and data pipelines and implement improvements to optimize performance     Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in MLOps and identify opportunities to improve our processes and infrastructure         Requirements:         Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, or a related field; Masters degree preferred     5-8 years of experience in MLOps, DevOps, or related field with large scale enterprise     Strong programming experience in multiple programming languages (java / j2ee / python / Nodejs / PowerShell)     Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases     Strong understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques     Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn     Expert in monitoring & APM tools such as DataDog, Azure Log Analytics, Splunk, New relic, Nagios, Graphite, Grafana etc.     High Proficiency on cloud technologies & infrastructure, preferably Azure     Experience with Databricks and Snowflake     Experience with Snowflakes Snow Pipes and Azure Data Factory (ADF)     Experience building and maintaining data pipelines using technologies such as Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, and/or Apache Airflow     Strong understanding of distributed systems and experience with cloud-based platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP     Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes     Experience with data storage and management systems such as Apache Hadoop, Spark, or Cassandra     Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently     Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team environment         Preferred Qualifications:         Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible or Chef     Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus or Elasticsearch/Kibana     Prior experience in Marketing analytics/Healthcare industry is preferred     If you are a highly skilled MLOps and Data Engineer with a passion for building and maintaining infrastructure to support machine learning models and data pipelines, and experience with Databricks, Snowflake, Snow Pipes, and ADF, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity
