column1: Manager - Supplier Relationship Management Centre of Excellence
column2: The Manager within the Supplier Relationship Management Centre of Excellence team (SRM CoE) will work with strategic supplier relationship managers (SRMs) in managing suppliers in line with risk appetite, optimising post-contract value, and developing a transparently sustainable supply base     The role holder will collaborate closely with senior stakeholders from across FIL to establish broad internal stakeholder relationships, drive value from, and manage risk within the Corporate Enablers supplier portfolio.      These stakeholders include but are not limited to onshore Head of Supplier Relationship Management, Supplier Relationship Managers (SRMs) across FIL; Supplier Risk Oversight (Procurement 2LoD function); Senior Procurement Category leaders; senior business stakeholders.     The Manager will establish routines for a defined element of the supplier portfolio, and will ensure that the requirements, contractual obligations, Procurement policy, and business unit objectives are met and evidenced in regular routines.         The role will be an individual contributor role. The role will require Managing and Executing processes for a Centre of Excellence geared towards measuring and governing supplier performance, compliance to contract and reducing supplier risk aimed at:                 Monitor and lead the performance delivery of the suppliers against agreed benchmarks. Develop an understanding of key contractual clauses and ensure compliance.     Create and run a mechanism for consistent and reliable handling of business queries towards SRM tasks, including ticket resolution, process trainings and process walk throughs.     Proven experience of delivering savings (avoiding contract leakage). Perform periodic supplier spend reconciliations for suppliers, tying back actual spend with contractual price.     Contribute to design and evolution of Process Unity routines and operationally manage Process Unity administration tasks.     Deliver best in class supplier management function for the group s strategic and / or operational 3rd party suppliers and proven experience of delivering savings (avoiding contract leakage). Analyse and understand supplier contract pricing and incoming invoice to arrive at the best method for spend reconciliation / leakage monitoring.     Be able to analyse and document contractual deliverables, business objectives and translate them to practical guidelines in line with SRM framework.      Provide business with data analytics and contractual review expertise required for SRM deliverables. Be an expert with strong individual contributor streaks, while being part of and managing small but high performing pods.     Analyse and document variations to services, ensuring necessary discipline / agreed change acceptance methodologies and that all activities meet the desired cost, risk & service parameters     Understand key policy requirements around different types of supplier risk, their identification and mitigation processes. Provide support to business users in performing risk identification and mitigation routines. Manage relationships with different     risk SMEs.     Ensure operational excellence through adherence to designed processes & process audits     Liaise with Stakeholders on multiple forums and deal with any ad-hoc queries from stakeholders     Run a structured query resolution service for stakeholders in Supplier Relationship Management area.     The role holder will be a key member of 5 FTE COE team located in Gurgaon and would form a broader community with 4 colleagues in UK and Ireland who will be responsible to create supplier strategies (commercial, contractual and risk) & active engagement, and oversight with these functions                 Experience and Qualifications Required             8+ years of work experience in financial services (desirable)     3+ Experience in managing supplier relationships, in a procurement role or as business stakeholder         Working experience under Supplier Relationship Management function entailing         Structured governance for continuous review and monitoring of key relationships     Measurement and reporting of supplier performance metrices and SLAs     Tracking and reporting of contractual delivery as well as financial commitments in IT categories             Enthusiastic, self-driven and with a high level of self-motivation to overcome obstacles and a strong desire to make things happen.     Ability to be flexible and responsive to a constantly changing environment.     Strong analytical skills, attention to details with an appetite to dive into issues in depth as needed     Strong personal presence, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to establish a successful rapport, communicate and influence at all levels.     Ability to complete multiple tasks against tight deadlines, able to prioritise and organise effectively     Excellent organisational skills, presentation of reports and attention to detail     Strong decision-making skills
column11: Procurement, Analytical skills, Supplier relationship management, Operational excellence, Finance, Reconciliation, Management, Individual Contributor, Financial services, SRM

column2: As a    Data Security Lead   , your role is critical in ensuring the protection and integrity of an organization s data. You will oversee the development, implementation, and management of data security programs, including the following critical components, Hands-on experience with tools like Forcepoint, Varonis, Thales, DSPM, OneTrust, PowerBI       1.    DLP (Data Loss Prevention):    You will be responsible for preventing unauthorized data leaks, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, and safeguarding sensitive information within the organization.     2.    Data Security:    Your role will involve monitoring and securing access to data, detecting abnormal user behavior, and preventing insider threats.     3.    Data Encryption:    You will implement encryption solutions to protect data at rest and in transit to safeguard sensitive data, ensuring confidentiality and integrity.     4.    DSPM (Data Security and Privacy Management):    As a Data Security Manager, you will establish and enforce data security policies, manage data access controls, and ensure compliance with privacy regulations.     5.    Data Access Rights Management:    Your role will involve monitoring, reviewing, and controlling user access to various digital resources within an organization. These resources may include databases, applications, files, folders, and network systems. You will be auditing user access rights to identify any discrepancies or unauthorized access.     6.    Data Privacy:    You will work closely with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to data privacy laws (such as GDPR, CCPA, etc.). This includes managing data subject requests, conducting privacy impact assessments, and maintaining privacy documentation.     7.    Data Analytics:    You will work to transform raw data into meaningful information, and actionable insights, supporting informed decisions, and fostering growth. A few key aspects like Data Collection, Data Cleaning, Data Analysis, Universal Relevance                 Key Responsibilities:               Policy Creation:    Develop and enforce policies for effective data management, ensuring adequacy, accuracy, and legitimacy of data.       Secure Procedures:    Implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis, considering technical aspects.       Data Sharing Rules:    Establish rules for data sharing within and outside the organization.       Monitoring and Troubleshooting:    Monitor and analyze information and data systems and troubleshoot data-related issues.       Data Security and Integrity:    Ensure data security and integrity across the organization.       Governance and Project Management:    Overseeing data protection governance for both new and existing initiatives/projects. Keeping stakeholders informed through regular reports on data protection strategies and policies.       Strategy Evaluation:    Assessment of existing data protection strategies and frameworks and Identifying areas for improvement or rectification.             Key Requirements:             Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.     Proven experience in data security management, including DLP, encryption, and access controls.     Familiarity with relevant regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) and industry best practices.     Mandatory certifications CISSP,     Strong technical acumen and problem-solving skills.     Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.         Key Knowledge and Experience:             Leadership skills: Ability to guide and influence teams.     Critical reviewer: Attention to detail and thoroughness.     Data analytics: Proficiency in analysing data.     Power BI: Familiarity with this data visualization tool.     Understanding of Tools: DLP, DSPM, CSPM, Data Classification, Data Encryption, AI and ML.     Knowledge of permissions, user behavior monitoring, and access control.     Awareness of privacy laws and compliance requirements.     Ability to manage data breaches and incidents.     Ability to manage compliance requirements like CIS, NIST, ISO, ISAE etc.     Results-oriented growth mindset with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes.     Excellent verbal and written communication skills.     Excellent relationship-building and negotiating skills.     Ability to manage multiple, critical projects is required.         Years of Experience:         10-15 years of relevant experience in data security management.
column11: Computer science, Data analysis, ISO, Project management, Information security, Relationship building, HIPAA, Data collection, Troubleshooting, Information technology

column2: What this job involves:       Data Architecture role is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to further advance their skillset in the field of Data-driven Digital Marketing. This will be a data-focused role that involves working with clients on data/audience strategy, data onboarding and data audience insights as well as internally with operations, analysts and client teams. The Analyst is responsible for discussing data strategies and DMP implementations with clients, leading audience targeting and optimization strategies across assigned accounts and working internally with the Programmatic buying teams to make sure the data strategies are implemented properly.     This is a client-facing role and you will be expected to communicate technical concepts to your assigned client(s) and to ensure account success and customer satisfaction. You will also be expected to learn the capabilities of multiple DSP and DMP platforms, attend training sessions with numerous vendors and communicate internally to their strengths and weaknesses.     If you can communicate well and work methodically as part of the team, we d like to meet you. The goal is to inspire and attract the target audience.       Sounds like you?       Manage data and audience strategy for programmatic advertising clients and communicate strategies/recommendations to clients using a consultative approach   Work with Data Management Platform (DMP) partners and manage day-to-day onboarding of client data.   Leverage data to assess, diagnose and prescribe campaign optimizations to exceed client expectations.   Extract insights from data and effectively communicate to clients in relation to their goals and objectives. Share results from audience analytics reports with clients when available.   Actively attend training sessions with various vendors and inquire about data and platform capabilities   Assist in the development of client-facing materials including data strategy presentations and audience performance reports   Develop a strong overall understanding of the client s business objective and demonstrate through campaign results how data targeting can help them achieve their business goals.   Participate in team meetings and knowledge sessions to share new strategies for targeting campaigns and to provide feedback on platform and data performance       Job specific Knowledge & Skills:         Experience managing Online Display, Video and Mobile campaigns   Understanding and experience with DSPs, DMPs, 3rd Party data, pixels and Ad Servers   Familiarity with customer acquisition goals and optimizing to CPA, CTR, Completion Rate, etc.   Strong analytical skills, technical know-how and strategic thinking   Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communications skills   Proficiency in Microsoft Office solutions   Highly organized with attention to detail       To apply - you need to be:         4-6 years prior digital advertising experience in a client services capacity with hands-on knowledge of the DSP/DMP landscape, as well as a passion for data-driven advertising and insights. Strong attention to detail and ability to follow projects through to completion   Ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience   Individual contributor role   Self-Sufficient
column11: Customer acquisition, DSP, Analytical skills, Data management, Digital marketing, Individual Contributor, MS Office, digital advertising, Analytics, Data architecture

column2: Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Power BI Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Power BI, DAX, SQL, and DevOps, with a proven track record of creating insightful and visually appealing dashboards for financial, warehouse and operational purposes. As a Power BI Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions that enable data-driven decision-making across the organization. Role & responsibilities     Develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights into key business metrics and performance indicators. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications for Power BI solutions. Design and implement data models using DAX and SQL to support the visualization of complex datasets. Create templates for financial and operational dashboards in Warehouse managment that can be easily customized and scaled across the business. Optimize Power BI reports and queries for performance and scalability, ensuring timely and reliable access to data. Work closely with the DevOps team to deploy and manage Power BI solutions in production environments, adhering to best practices for security and governance. Provide training and support to end users on how to effectively use Power BI for data analysis and reporting. Utilize dbt (Data Build Tool) to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring data consistency and reliability for reporting purposes. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in Power BI, dbt, Snowflake, and related technologies, and proactively recommend enhancements to our BI infrastructure.  Proficient in GitHub for version control, collaboration, and project management, including repository management, pull requests, code reviews, issue tracking, CI/CD integration, and documentation  Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. 8 to 12 years of experience working as a Power BI Developer or Business Intelligence Analyst. Proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, Power Pivot, and Power View. Strong understanding of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and SQL for data modelling and manipulation. Experience with DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD). Familiarity with dbt (Data Build Tool) for data transformation and modeling. Experience working with Snowflake or other cloud-based data warehouses. Solid understanding of data visualization best practices and principles. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Certification in Power BI,dbt, Snowflake, or related technologies is a plus. Perks and benefits

column2: As the senior manager of the data engineering team, you will be entrusted with the delivery of scalable services that empower our customers to maximize return on brand outreach and recruitment. Data Analytics Engineer Manager role will be critical to help drive analysis, data science, and reporting across many diverse data sets to make sure we deliver impact from our data products and services    - The team is responsible for real time analytics and reporting for executive-level insights down to granular recruiter analysis. In this role you will be responsible for technical projects or programs, working closely with product managers, engineers and technical staff to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts across our suite of products.        Your responsibilities will include:         - Design, architect, and develop code in a testable, scalable, and performant manner    - Attract talent, manage hiring and training of new engineers    - Build, manage and mentor a talented team of 3- 5 Data Engineers of all levels, aiding them in their own career growth    - Work closely with Product Managers, Cross Product Engineers and Data Engineers to optimize and deliver innovative solutions    - Build a team that mines, analyzes, and transforms large [un]structured datasets, collaborating with analysts, data scientists, and business users to create actionable metrics and datasets that solve business questions    - Develop a plan and schedule with well-defined milestones.    - Digging in alongside the team in a crunch scenario or to solve a critical issue    - Manage and facilitate technical design discussions, contribute significant verbal and written contributions, and help your team overcome hurdles.    - Run engineering processes including sprint planning, training and timely delivery of product - in collaboration with product and engineering leaders    - Work with team to develop automated testing protocols and deploy tests with every release    - Utilize an agile approach to process and structure.    - Foster a healthy and collaborative culture that embodies our team values.    - Provide expertise in query building and data modeling to ensure data is made available in a timely, efficient, and comprehendible means    - Partner with our other teams to ensure documentation, privacy, and best in class coding practices are implemented within Analytical engineering    - Act as SME for specific data domains by enabling analytical data sets for internal ad-hoc analysis    - Engage with key stakeholders in the business, product and software teams to clearly understand and scope analytical requests    - Enable the team to expand its impact, by improving delivery mechanisms and working closely with the data, product and growth organizations to increase the value we can bring to our customers          What you will bring       - column2: Role Summary: We are seeking a talented and passionate Data engineer to join our growing team. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining the user interfaces of our innovative B2B SaaS platform. You will work closely with the design team, back-end developers, and other stakeholders to bring our product vision to life. You will use various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. For example, youll create algorithms and conduct statistical analysis. Overall, youll strive for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals. Your prime role would involve the following items in your day-to-day work: Analyze and organize raw data  Build data systems and pipelines Evaluate business needs and objectives Interpret trends and patterns Conduct complex data analysis and report on results  Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modelling Build algorithms and prototypes Combine raw information from different sources Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability Identify opportunities for data acquisition Develop analytical tools and programs Collaborate with data scientists and architects on several projects Responsibilities: Design and implement scalable and maintainable data models for complex systems. Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques and great numerical and analytical skills Develop and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines using Azure data engineering tools (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks) to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources (e.g., databases, APIs, logs) Knowledge of programming languages (preferably, Python, Julia) and any one of Web development frameworks (like Django, Flask, FastAPI etc.) Optimize data pipelines for performance AND cost efficiency. Monitor data pipelines and infrastructure for potential issues and implement proactive maintenance strategies. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data engineering tools and technologies, including Azure data services and cloud cost management solutions. Document data models, pipelines, processes, and cost allocation procedures for future reference. Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, Azure SQL Database). Proven experience with Azure data engineering tools (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks). Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and cloud-based data platforms. Expertise in data modelling and ETL/ELT processes. Strong programming skills (Python, SQL) and experience with scripting languages (e.g., Bash). Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Passion for data and a desire to build beautiful, efficient, and cost-effective data solutions. Bonus Points: Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes). Experience with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines. Familiarity with cloud security best practices. Data engineering certification on Azure is a plus Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package including early stage ESOP. Opportunity to work on a challenging and impactful project. column2: Analyze data to identify trends, opportunities, and insights to improve sales and profitability on various marketplaces         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies for business growth         Monitor inventory levels and replenishment schedules for the FBA warehouses to ensure timely and accurate replenishments         Work with the buying team, vendor relationship team, and pricing team to develop pricing strategies to optimize sales and profitability         Implement AI technology like ChatGPT or equivalent AI tools to enforce automation of manual work within the BI and other departments         Create various business reports covering the sales, profitability, and performance of the FBA team across all levels using various BI tools         Develop statistical models to predict the replenishments of quantity to Amazon FBA         Ensure that the aged inventory at any given point in time does not exceed the threshold limits.                   Qualification:                 Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field         Minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or related field         Experience with Amazon FBA and other marketplaces         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills         Proficiency in SQL, Excel, BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI, and statistical analysis tools like R or Python         Excellent communication and presentation skills         Experience with implementing AI technology or ChatGPT or equivalent AI tools         Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment         Strong organizational and time-management skills                 Soft Skills:                 Leadership:    As a manager, you must be able to lead and inspire your team, set clear goals, and provide guidance to achieve them.       Communication:    Effective communication is vital to convey complex technical concepts, business insights, and project requirements to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.       Problem-Solving:    BI Managers encounter various challenges; hence, strong problem-solving skills are necessary to analyze situations, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions.       Analytical Thinking:    Your ability to analyze data and interpret insights will directly impact strategic decision-making, making analytical thinking a critical skill.       Decision-Making:    Managers in BI often face time-sensitive decisions. The capacity to make informed, data-driven decisions is paramount for success.       Team Building and Collaboration:    Building a cohesive team, fostering a collaborative environment, and promoting knowledge-sharing is key to enhancing the overall performance of your team.               Technical Skills:                 Data Warehousing:    Comprehensive knowledge of data warehousing concepts, methodologies, and tools is crucial to manage and optimize data storage and retrieval processes.       Business Intelligence Tools:    Proficiency in popular BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or others is essential for data visualization and reporting.       SQL:    A strong command of SQL is necessary to retrieve and manipulate data from various databases efficiently.       Data Modeling:    Understanding data models and designing effective data structures are fundamental to the success of BI projects.       ETL (Extract, Transform, Load):    Knowledge of ETL processes and tools is essential to extract data from multiple sources, transform it, and load it into the data warehouse.       Database Management Systems (DBMS):    Familiarity with various database systems and their optimization techniques is crucial for managing data effectively.

column2: Summary: - We have an exciting opportunity for a self-motivated Team Leader MIS and Analytics to join our team and provide support to Alpine Wellness. As part of our inclusive and dynamic team, youll be empowered to own your career and make an impact. Youll work in a fast-paced, agile environment and use your great communication skills to engage with all levels of our stakeholders across the business as you take ownership of end-to-end executive administration for multiple senior leaders.    Job Description: Create reports and presentations for senior management. Make recommendations to supervisors and senior management for improvements, focusing on increasing profitability. Analyze large data sets to discover trends, patterns, and correlations that will assist managers in making informed business decisions. Produce reports and analyses to ensure decision makers receive timely, actionable information. Use data driven analysis to identify and facilitate opportunities for process improvement. Work with Technology & Operations teams to design and implement changes to the suite of information systems and tools. Handle ad hoc and standard reporting responsibilities for the entire user base. Work with stakeholders to ensure timely and accurate MIS tracking. Identify and develop new management information (MI) initiatives improving the quality and efficiency of MI production. Perform impact analysis for changes to operational application processes and data that may affect the informational environment. Continuously improve the accuracy, content, and clarity of management reports related to KPMs and overall operational performance. Use internal and external data sources to create a complete picture of the variables that influence performance. The candidate will also need to gain an understanding of the sales process to better align changes to the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system. Data Interpretation and Visualization: Translate complex data sets into understandable insights and visualizations using tools like Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization platforms. column1: Total Rewards and People Analytics Specialist
column2: You will be successful in this role if you re someone who has advanced analytical and problem-solving skills, strong data mining experience, and can take ownership of tasks and see them through to execution. While this isn t a people leadership role, your success will be based on building strong relationships with the business globally (employees and leaders) to assert yourself as a subject-matter expert.             What you ll be doing every day:           Utilize your advanced Microsoft Excel skills to design, develop, and maintain comprehensive compensation ranges and structures that align with our global compensation strategy.         Conduct thorough analysis of compensation data to ensure internal and external equity, making recommendations for adjustments as necessary.         Lead and contribute to compensation surveys and benchmarking efforts to ensure our compensation packages remain competitive on a global scale.         Facilitate the gathering of bi-annual performance reviews and conduct performance cycle leader training.         Analytical development of recommendations for annual merit cycle         Bonus cycle preparation and analysis         Responsible for the job evaluation process and job evaluations         Responsible for review and recommendations for variable pay program implementations and changes, including commission and bonus programs.         Responsible for annual market pay reviews, including alignment on surveys.         Create the monthly P&C people analytics deck, recommend value-added changes.         Data-led critical thinker with business acumen         Knowledge of city, county, state, provincial, and federal requirements for pay programs           What you bring to the table:           Prior experience in Compensation is required and Sales Compensation is preferred.         College or University degree is preferred but not required.         Minimum 2-3 years experience working in a Total Rewards function as an Analyst or Specialist.         Must have directly managed compensation programs and annual total rewards cycles (i.e., merit and variable pay).         A minimum of 2 years of experience generating robust People Analytics dashboards is preferred.         Intermediate to advanced level Microsoft Excel skills required. Must have experience using Excel to analyze large data sets quickly and accurately. Familiarity with Google Sheets is an asset.           Ideally, you also have experience with some of:           Workday HRIS

column2: Driving traffic analytics at adidas e-commerce, you are responsible for delivering cutting-edge Analytical services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions     Based on internal & external data sources, you manage the creation and generation of tools, data capabilities, optimizations and insights that help adidas better understand the consumer, expand reach, increase customer engagement and advocacy, and ultimately drive traffic, conversion and sales     In collaboration with your team, you drive and execute planning and analytics strategy and services across Emerging Markets focusing on Digital Marketing Analytics, Traffic & Media measurement and optimization, working closely with e-com and Brand Activation team             Key Responsibilities:            Digital Marketing Analytics       :         Drive EM e-com traffic analytics (all level of macro and micro KPIs) for our Website, Apps and Digital Platforms / eMarketplaces.          Own and drive consolidation, measurement of results and optimization of traffic generation and related conversion and ROI/ROAS, aligning and developing a global-aligned reporting framework that evaluates dimensions such as awareness, engagement and purchasing behavior. Provide insights about adidas brand awareness and e-commerce performance.          Collaborate and support Performance Marketing Brand team, Digital Brand Activations team and e-com UX and CE teams to achieve the Premium Shopping Experience value proposition and relevant Personalization across all digital touch points, to support enhancements to traffic generation, site usability, content, marketing, and overall customer experience.          Closely collaborate with the e-com forecasting team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep-dives for e-com channel forecasts, campaigns and pre-post mortems, traffic acquisition strategies & overall business objectives.          Conduct collection, tracking, mining and analysis of data and generation of fact-based insights, using a single data source.          Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of e-com organic and paid media traffic.          Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization.          Monitor and analyze market trends and competitor activities and derive conclusions for the growth and optimization of adidas digital traffic generation activities.          Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through application of the full set of advanced analysis methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modeling.          Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered KPIs analysis and insights. Drive the translation of gathered insights into engaging, actionable and easy to digest insights presentation and implementations to ensure KPIs gaps, risks and uplift are closed and targets are achieved.          Implement analytics tools/reporting framework within e-commerce to facilitate every decision maker access to the information needed in the shape needed dashboards, visualization tools, reports etc          Support execution of online campaigns through effective analytics focusing on uncovering trends in traffic, KPIs, customer behavior and sales          Ensure tools and systems daily routines & activities, refresh, updates and scheduling.          Support deep-dives, ad-hoc analysis and contextual dashboards with relevant platforms and channels.          Develop and maintain a strong stakeholder network with high level of trust that facilitates action- ability of insights.          Advise stakeholders in your area of responsibility on digital analytics to define goals, select appropriate KPIs, monitor performance and derive trends and opportunities.          Keep the continuous development of the analytics practice in scope, including service portfolio evolution and constant screening of the ecosystem for new models, capabilities, partners or solutions.          Build a strong internal and external network, informing the adidas Digital Analytics community on the latest trends and technological advances.          Key Relationships:          EM Hub e-com team          EM Function teams (Finance, DNA, Brand, Sales, SCM )          Country-Clusters (C/C) e-commerce teams          Country-Clusters (C/C) market teams & group functions          Global Digital teams          Global BI & Analytics teams          External vendors          Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:          Experience in Marketing Analytics, Attribution, etc, challenging the status quo          Great communication skills & command over the language          Degree with focus in Business, Finance, Economics, Math, Data Science or related field preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience          Minimum 3-5 years of experience working in Digital Analytics, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Demand forecasting & planning, Data Science or equivalent experience          Advanced experience with digital marketing in a brand environment          Functional knowledge of e-commerce content, search engine optimization/marketing, user experience, analytics, core e-Commerce capabilities, CRM process/program, and overlaps/opportunities in relation to behavioral web data          Experience in traffic generation, in-house or at a leading traffic/media agency.          Experience in or familiarity with analytics platforms, especially in their integration or deriving insights requiring multiple sources          Industry: Ideally in apparel/fashion/shoes or internet          Knowledge & Soft Skills   :        Deep knowledge of Digital and e-com analytics          Ability to efficiently work in a cross-functional organization, ability to develop influential and collaborative relationships with stakeholders from digital and non-digital disciplines on all levels          Excellent communication & negotiation skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to technical and non-technical audience both in person and remotely at various organizational levels          A passion for designing and creating new data capabilities, tools, and frameworks. Interest in back-of-house development of analytics capabilities. Devotion to accuracy, reliability, rigor, and user-focused design.          Meticulous, high attention to details          Creative and energetic team player who has a passion for delivering analytics, data, insights to drive outcomes for quantifiable improvements in business results and consumer satisfaction.          Broad understanding of and passion for the sports and fashion/entertainment industry          Hard Skills   :        Advanced experience in Digital Analytics, BI, Financial, Digital tools          Hands-on experience with analytics, statistics, data visualization, and analytics tools and disciplines          Proficient in MS Office (with an emphasis on Excel), Alteryx or at least one querying language          Experience with process design and process improvements, automation, etc          Proven project management skills, including the ability to lead projects or work on several projects simultaneously.          Hands-on Advanced experience in tools (GA 360, Adobe Analytics) is a must          Advanced experience with mobile app measurement platforms (iOS/Android Appsflyer/ Adjust/ etc)          Experience in relevant digital disciplines (e-com, Social, online communities, loyalty programs, CRM, SEO/SEM)          Advanced experience with Analytics Blending & Visualization Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Alteryx, SQL )          Plus would be considered:          Experience in forecasting and predictive models          Experience with Advanced Analytics Tools/ language     (R, Python, SQL,etc )          Advanced experience with traffic analytics tools, marketing & media KPIs and ROI          Advanced experience with reporting and digital marketing SCV, propensity modelling etc).          Experience with Voice of the Customer tool (Martitz CX, Medallia, Qualtrics)          Customer Experience Measurement (Tealeaf CEM, Clicktale, QM, Crazyegg)          Experience with AB and Multi-variate testing tools preferred (e.g. Optimizely, VWO, Test & Target)          Fluent English both verbally and written                COURAGE:    Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..           OWNERSHIP:    Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow-through.           INNOVATION:    Elevate to win. column2: We are looking for an experienced database architect who could join our engineering team to build the next-gen applications for our global customers      If you are a technology enthusiast and have a passion for developing enterprise cloud products with quality, security, and performance, we are eager to discuss with you about the potential role                  Responsibilities:          Database Development:              Design and construct efficient, scalable, and large database solutions for SaaS products.      Design database applications, such as interfaces, data transfer mechanisms, global temporary tables, data partitions, and function-based indexes to enable efficient access to the generic database structure.      Design strategies for enterprise database systems and set standards for operations, programming, and security.      Identify and correct deviations from database development standards.      Document and communicate database schemas, using accepted notations.      Architect data models for applications, metadata tables, views, or related DB structures.      Provide technical support to junior staff and development teams.      Identify, evaluate, and recommend hardware or software technologies to achieve desired DB performance.      Collaborate with software architects and developers to implement the requirements.      Research industry best practices in emerging technologies and implement them into database design.              Data Migration/Integration:              Integrate new systems with existing warehousing structures and refine system performance and functionality.      Leverage experience with ETL tools such as ADF and SSIS to facilitate seamless data migration.      Design and implement data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.      Ensure data integrity during the ETL process and troubleshoot any issues that may arise.      Implement Azure Datalake & Azure data warehousing, including data extraction, transformation, and loading.      Architect and maintain scalable data warehousing solutions - SaaS and On-Prem.      Architect and implement reporting solutions for large data- SaaS and On-Prem.      Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and implement effective solutions.          12+ years of hands-on experience in architecting and developing cloud and on-prem database solutions on MS SQL, and PostgreSQL.      Proficient in MS SQL Server, Distributed PostgreSQL, Citus, Azure Datalake SSRS, and SSIS.      Familiarity with tools related to data migration, data warehousing, data modeling, data integration, and database design is preferred.      Working knowledge of GIT, Jira, and version control of database scripts and configurations.      Experience in database performance analysis using Dynatrace, Newrelic, or similar tools.      Experience in BI / Reporting tools like Apache Superset, and PowerBI.      Ability to grasp new concepts and facilitate continuous learning.      Strong sense of responsibility and accountability

column2: At Integrate, we treat data as a critical corporate asset and differentiator in our business. We are looking for an outstanding Associate Product Analytics Lead to help drive the effectiveness of our products through data.          You will be partnering with senior data science, data engineering, business and product leadership to do great things.          Ultimately your work will focus on measuring and improving corporate performance, product performance and outcomes for our customers.         You are passionate about problem-solving and always take a customer-centric approach.          You know how to energize cross-functional teams around a problem and use data to identify and prioritize solutions.          You are skilled at creating meaningful analysis with large, complex datasets and using the tools of your trade: query languages, ETL tools, data modeling & data visualization.          You are at your best when tackling new problems and supporting innovation.                 The Team:                   We are a diverse group o     f Integrators who believe that being smart about how we use data can lead to better products and more value for our clients. We dont just pull data and create analyses; we create compelling stories driven by the context of our customers and the vision of Integrate. We believe we are strongest when we support each other, and that learning is always p     art of the job.               Job Responsibilities                  Lead the measuring of success of each product including metrics that cover product performance, adoption and utilization, and outcomes.             Work with the key stakeholders to determine the measures of success and guide good usage of outcome driven metrics.             Compile user, transaction, and other data from complex systems to generate reports and analyses for partner and stakeholder groups.             Synthesize results to determine success or failure of experiments and make recommendations on go forward plan.             Develop and manage strong, collaborative relationships with associated data science, product team and other stakeholders, as needed, to help drive results.             Typical Qualifications                  5+ years professional experience, inclusive of a minimum of 3-5 years of data analytics              Ability to effectively create reports and synthesize data into digestible and actionable information. Ability to synthesize complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve business problems.             Knowledge of, and ability to use, strategies, techniques and tools for effective communication of technical ideas to various audiences. Strong understanding of database technologies and ability to write code to gather data.              Able to take a pro-active view of data analytics in the context of data-backed products and provide insights that can help drive increased adoption and use of our offerings.             Bachelor s Degree required; Degree (Bachelor s or Masters) in a quantitative discipline like Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or Mathematics.           Integrate in the News:           Best Tech Startups in Arizona (2018-2021)      Integrate Acquires Akkroo      Integrate Acquires ListenLoop      Why Four MarTech CEOs Bet Big on Integrate

column2: As the Data Science/Ai/ML Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the development and implementation of data-driven solutions and strategies. Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, Big Data Analytics, Warehousing, Machine Learning and Computer Vision.      Expertise in statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization techniques.      Solid understanding of data manipulation, feature engineering, and data preprocessing techniques.      Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into data science solutions.      Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.      Experience working in Agile or Scrum methodologies is preferred.      Proven ability to lead and mentor a team, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.              Qualifications:    M.E./M. Tech (Data Analytics)        Other Requirements          Good communication and presentation skills      Six Sigma Exposure      Ability to multitask and communicate with product owners      Problem solving skills      Design Thinking      Have passion for Design & Technology      Should have a can do attitude.

column2: We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing Business Intelligence solutions to provide actionable insights to support business decision-making. The Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant will collaborate with clients and internal teams to understand data requirements, create insightful visualizations and interactive dashboards, and ensure the successful deployment of BI solutions, leveraging our implementation of Apache Superset.           Your main responsibilities               Requirements Gathering:   Work closely with clients and stakeholders to understand their business needs and data requirements for visualisation and reporting.               Data Modelling:   Design and implement efficient data models in Apache Superset based on business requirements. Design and develop interactive and visually appealing dashboards using Tableau; Ensure data integrity and optimise performance for large datasets.               Dashboard Development:   Develop interactive and visually appealing reports and dashboards. Implement custom visuals and calculations as needed.               Data Preparation and Integration:    Prepare and Integrate data from various sources into Superset, ensuring accuracy and completeness; Implement ETL processes for data transformation and cleansing.               Performance Optimization:   Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in Superset reports and dashboards; Optimize queries and data refresh schedules for optimal performance.               Documentation:   Create and maintain documentation for Superset solutions, including data models, calculations, and best practices.           Qualifications           Your qualifications             B.E. in Computer Science or related field and equivalent experience             Experience of 4-6 years implementing a Business Intelligence solution (e.g.: Power BI, Tableau)             Scripting/Programming skills SQL is a must, Python/JS is a nice to have.             Familiarity with data modelling tools             Excellent interpersonal and external communication skills with very good level of proficiency in spoken and written English. Being able to discuss changes with a technical and non-technical audience is important.             Exposure to aircraft/engine engineering or operation is a plus.             Full cycle software development experience is a plus           Job Benefits         We offer a competitive compensation package depending on your profile. You will have a unique opportunity of being part of a young and fast-growing team where you can make your mark. This may include taking over and growing our service delivery for a marquee customer depending on your experience, skills, and drive. Compensation to be commensurate to your experience.

column2: The Data Analyst will be responsible for collating, maintaining, and analysing data for international and national interest projects in the TRAFFIC India Office. This will result in projects of international and national importance to address issues in the supply chains of natural resources, evaluation, and production of informative outputs on transborder wildlife trade dynamics. S/he will be responsible for designing, analysing, and producing relevant interventions in collaboration with partners/stakeholders in their implementations. This will be achieved in collaboration with other TRAFFIC staff (across the globe) and WWF staff in India, and other offices.                                                       Job Profile:                           Scanning open-source media/databases/published data for reported cases of wildlife crime and illegal trade.                                           Catalogue trade data for natural resources such as medicinal plants, timber and fisheries                       Monthly report on the trends of Illegal wildlife trade, and wildlife crime, for key species/groups.                       Monitor cyberspace for key species in illegal trade for specific species/groups.                       Assist in the preparation/review of training manuals/tools/technologies for enhancing the capacity of LEA, or relevant agencies.                       Assist and facilitate with researching background information, proposals, reports.                       Assist in project and program development and any other project-related work as instructed by the Associate Director.                     Scanning open-source media/databases/published data for reported cases of wildlife crime and illegal trade.                   Catalogue trade data for natural resources such as medicinal plants, timber and fisheries                               Monthly report on the trends of Illegal wildlife trade, and wildlife crime, for key species/groups.                   Monitor cyberspace for key species in illegal trade for specific species/groups.                               Assist in the preparation/review of training manuals/tools/technologies for enhancing the capacity of LEA, or relevant agencies.                   Assist and facilitate with researching background information, proposals, reports. Capacity building programs for LEA/ other agencies.                     Assist in project and program development and any other project-related work as instructed by the Associate Director.                                             Key Deliverables:                         Daily update of wildlife crime database, and create a dashboard for the same.                     Monthly report on the trends of Illegal wildlife trade, and wildlife crime, for key species/groups.                         Annually two reports (Annual) on the trade (legal/illegal) for certain key species/groups.                             Desired Qualifications and Experience:                       A Masters degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in the conservation sector             .                             A minimum of 3 years of experience working on data in the conservation sector, in program development.                             Proven experience of working with government law enforcement agencies on wildlife trade.                           Experience in            data science, information management, with a bit of statistics/ statistical programming                             Working experience of tolls such as (paid programs) Matlab, SPSS, SAS, Jupyter, or (open-sourced) R including coding in R, Python, and scripting languages with creation of API such as MS, VB, or .NET using database (Access, or MS SQL) with web application HTML 5 or CSS 3.

column2: Driving traffic analytics at adidas e-commerce, you are responsible for delivering cutting-edge Analytical services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions       Based on internal external data sources, you manage the creation and generation of tools, data capabilities, optimizations and insights that help adidas better understand the consumer, expand reach, increase customer engagement and advocacy, and ultimately drive traffic, conversion and sales     In collaboration with your team, you drive and execute planning and analytics strategy and services across Emerging Markets focusing on Digital Marketing Analytics, Traffic Media measurement and optimization, working closely with e-com and Brand Activation team                           Key Responsibilities:                                Digital Marketing Analytics                   :                                 Drive EM e-com traffic analytics (all level of macro and micro KPIs) for our Website, Apps and Digital Platforms / eMarketplaces.                                  Own and drive consolidation, measurement of results and optimization of traffic generation and related conversion and ROI/ROAS, aligning and developing a global-aligned reporting framework that evaluates dimensions such as awareness, engagement and purchasing behavior. Provide insights about adidas brand awareness and e-commerce performance.                                 Collaborate and support Performance Marketing Brand team, Digital Brand Activations team and e-com UX and CE teams to achieve the Premium Shopping Experience value proposition and relevant Personalization across all digital touch points, to support enhancements to traffic generation, site usability, content, marketing, and overall customer experience.                                 Closely collaborate with the e-com forecasting team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep-dives for e-com channel forecasts, campaigns and pre-post mortems, traffic acquisition strategies overall business objectives.                                 Conduct collection, tracking, mining and analysis of data and generation of fact-based insights, using a single data source.                                 Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of e-com organic and paid media traffic.                                 Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization.                                 Monitor and analyze market trends and competitor activities and derive conclusions for the growth and optimization of adidas digital traffic generation activities.                                 Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through application of the full set of advanced analysis methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modeling.                                 Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered KPIs analysis and insights. Drive the translation of gathered insights into engaging, actionable and easy to digest insights presentation and implementations to ensure KPIs gaps, risks and uplift are closed and targets are achieved.                                  Implement analytics tools/reporting framework within e-commerce to facilitate every decision maker access to the information needed in the shape needed dashboards, visualization tools, reports etc                                  Support execution of online campaigns through effective analytics focusing on uncovering trends in traffic, KPIs, customer behavior and sales                                 Ensure tools and systems daily routines activities, refresh, updates and scheduling.                                 Support deep-dives, ad-hoc analysis and contextual dashboards with relevant platforms and channels.                                  Develop and maintain a strong stakeholder network with high level of trust that facilitates action- ability of insights.                                 Advise stakeholders in your area of responsibility on digital analytics to define goals, select appropriate KPIs, monitor performance and derive trends and opportunities.                                 Keep the continuous development of the analytics practice in scope, including service portfolio evolution and constant screening of the ecosystem for new models, capabilities, partners or solutions.                                 Build a strong internal and external network, informing the adidas Digital Analytics community on the latest trends and technological advances.                             Key Relationships:                              EM Hub e-com team                             EM Function teams (Finance, DNA, Brand, Sales, SCM )                             Country-Clusters (C/C) e-commerce teams                              Country-Clusters (C/C) market teams group functions                              Global Digital teams                              Global BI Analytics teams                             External vendors                                                         Degree with focus in Business, Finance, Economics, Math, Data Science or related field preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience                             Minimum 3-5 years of experience working in Digital Analytics, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Demand forecasting planning, Data Science or equivalent experience                                 Advanced experience with digital marketing in a brand environment                                     Functional knowledge of e-commerce content, search engine optimization/marketing, user experience, analytics, core e-Commerce capabilities, CRM process/program, and overlaps/opportunities in relation to behavioral web data                                     Experience in traffic generation, in-house or at a leading traffic agency.                                 Experience in or familiarity with analytics platforms, especially in their integration or deriving insights requiring multiple sources                             Industry: Ideally in apparel/fashion/shoes or internet                                  Knowledge Soft Skills           :                                Deep knowledge of Digital and e-com analytics                                 Ability to efficiently work in a cross-functional organization, ability to develop influential and collaborative relationships with stakeholders from digital and non-digital disciplines on all levels                                 Excellent communication negotiation skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to technical and non-technical audience both in person and remotely at various organizational levels                                 A passion for designing and creating new data capabilities, tools, and frameworks. Interest in back-of-house development of analytics capabilities. Devotion to accuracy, reliability, rigor, and user-focused design.                                 Meticulous, high attention to details                                 Creative and energetic team player who has a passion for delivering analytics, data, insights to drive outcomes for quantifiable improvements in business results and consumer satisfaction.                                 Broad understanding of and passion for the sports and fashion/entertainment industry                                 Hard Skills               :                                Advanced experience in Digital Analytics, BI, Financial, Digital tools                                 Hands-on experience with analytics, statistics, data visualization, and analytics tools and disciplines                                 Proficient in MS Office (with an emphasis on Excel), Alteryx or at least one querying language                                 Experience with process design and process improvements, automation, etc                                 Proven project management skills, including the ability to lead projects or work on several projects simultaneously.                     Plus would be considered:                     Experience in forecasting and predictive models                                 Advanced experience with Analytics Blending Visualization Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Alteryx, SQL )                                 Advanced experience with traffic analytics tools, marketing media KPIs and ROI                                 Advanced experience with reporting and digital marketing tools (GA 360, doubleclick, Adobe Analytics, SCV, propensity modelling etc).                                 Advanced experience Experience with Web Analytics and Native app (iOS/Android) analytics (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Webtrends, Wetrekk, Amplitude, AppsFlyer, FireBase ).                                 Experience with Voice of the Customer tool (Martitz CX, Medallia, Qualtrics)                                 Experience with Advanced Analytics Tools/ language    (R, Python, SQL,etc )                                   Customer Experience Measurement (Tealeaf CEM, Clicktale, QM, Crazyegg)                                 Experience in relevant digital disciplines (e-com, Social, online communities, loyalty programs, CRM, SEO/SEM)                                 Experience with AB and Multi-variate testing tools preferred (e.g. Optimizely, VWO, Test Target)                                     Fluent English both verbally and written                               COURAGE:    Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need..           OWNERSHIP:    Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow-through.           INNOVATION:    Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.           TEAMPLAY:    Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.           INTEGRITY:    Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company s standards.           RESPECT:    Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all.

column2: Driving traffic analytics at adidas e-commerce, you are responsible for delivering cutting-edge Analytical services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions       Based on internal external data sources, you manage the creation and generation of tools, data capabilities, optimizations and insights that help adidas better understand the consumer, expand reach, increase customer engagement and advocacy, and ultimately drive traffic, conversion and sales     In collaboration with your team, you drive and execute planning and analytics strategy and services across Emerging Markets focusing on Digital Marketing Analytics, Traffic Media measurement and optimization, working closely with e-com and Brand Activation team                           Key Responsibilities:                                Digital Marketing Analytics                   :                                 Drive EM e-com traffic analytics (all level of macro and micro KPIs) for our Website, Apps and Digital Platforms / eMarketplaces.                                  Own and drive consolidation, measurement of results and optimization of traffic generation and related conversion and ROI/ROAS, aligning and developing a global-aligned reporting framework that evaluates dimensions such as awareness, engagement and purchasing behavior. Provide insights about adidas brand awareness and e-commerce performance.                                 Collaborate and support Performance Marketing Brand team, Digital Brand Activations team and e-com UX and CE teams to achieve the Premium Shopping Experience value proposition and relevant Personalization across all digital touch points, to support enhancements to traffic generation, site usability, content, marketing, and overall customer experience.                                 Closely collaborate with the e-com forecasting team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep-dives for e-com channel forecasts, campaigns and pre-post mortems, traffic acquisition strategies overall business objectives.                                 Conduct collection, tracking, mining and analysis of data and generation of fact-based insights, using a single data source.                                 Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of e-com organic and paid media traffic.                                 Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization.                                 Monitor and analyze market trends and competitor activities and derive conclusions for the growth and optimization of adidas digital traffic generation activities.                                 Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through application of the full set of advanced analysis methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modeling.                                 Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered KPIs analysis and insights. Drive the translation of gathered insights into engaging, actionable and easy to digest insights presentation and implementations to ensure KPIs gaps, risks and uplift are closed and targets are achieved.                                  Implement analytics tools/reporting framework within e-commerce to facilitate every decision maker access to the information needed in the shape needed dashboards, visualization tools, reports etc                                  Support execution of online campaigns through effective analytics focusing on uncovering trends in traffic, KPIs, customer behavior and sales                                 Ensure tools and systems daily routines activities, refresh, updates and scheduling.                                 Support deep-dives, ad-hoc analysis and contextual dashboards with relevant platforms and channels.                                  Develop and maintain a strong stakeholder network with high level of trust that facilitates action- ability of insights.                                 Advise stakeholders in your area of responsibility on digital analytics to define goals, select appropriate KPIs, monitor performance and derive trends and opportunities.                                 Keep the continuous development of the analytics practice in scope, including service portfolio evolution and constant screening of the ecosystem for new models, capabilities, partners or solutions.                                 Build a strong internal and external network, informing the adidas Digital Analytics community on the latest trends and technological advances.                             Key Relationships:                              EM Hub e-com team                             EM Function teams (Finance, DNA, Brand, Sales, SCM )                             Country-Clusters (C/C) e-commerce teams                              Country-Clusters (C/C) market teams group functions                              Global Digital teams                              Global BI Analytics teams                             External vendors                                                         Degree with focus in Business, Finance, Economics, Math, Data Science or related field preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience                             Minimum 3-5 years of experience working in Digital Analytics, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Demand forecasting planning, Data Science or equivalent experience                                 Advanced experience with digital marketing in a brand environment                                     Functional knowledge of e-commerce content, search engine optimization/marketing, user experience, analytics, core e-Commerce capabilities, CRM process/program, and overlaps/opportunities in relation to behavioral web data                                     Experience in traffic generation, in-house or at a leading traffic agency.                                 Experience in or familiarity with analytics platforms, especially in their integration or deriving insights requiring multiple sources                             Industry: Ideally in apparel/fashion/shoes or internet                                  Knowledge Soft Skills           :                                Deep knowledge of Digital and e-com analytics                                 Ability to efficiently work in a cross-functional organization, ability to develop influential and collaborative relationships with stakeholders from digital and non-digital disciplines on all levels                                 Excellent communication negotiation skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to technical and non-technical audience both in person and remotely at various organizational levels                                 A passion for designing and creating new data capabilities, tools, and frameworks. Interest in back-of-house development of analytics capabilities. Devotion to accuracy, reliability, rigor, and user-focused design.                                 Meticulous, high attention to details                                 Creative and energetic team player who has a passion for delivering analytics, data, insights to drive outcomes for quantifiable improvements in business results and consumer satisfaction.                                 Broad understanding of and passion for the sports and fashion/entertainment industry                                 Hard Skills               :                                Advanced experience in Digital Analytics, BI, Financial, Digital tools                                 Hands-on experience with analytics, statistics, data visualization, and analytics tools and disciplines                                 Proficient in MS Office (with an emphasis on Excel), Alteryx or at least one querying language                                 Experience with process design and process improvements, automation, etc                                 Proven project management skills, including the ability to lead projects or work on several projects simultaneously.                     Plus would be considered:                     Experience in forecasting and predictive models                                 Advanced experience with Analytics Blending Visualization Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Alteryx, SQL )                                 Advanced experience with traffic analytics tools, marketing media KPIs and ROI                                 Advanced experience with reporting and digital marketing tools (GA 360, doubleclick, Adobe Analytics, SCV, propensity modelling etc).                                 Advanced experience Experience with Web Analytics and Native app (iOS/Android) analytics (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Webtrends, Wetrekk, Amplitude, AppsFlyer, FireBase ).                                 Experience with Voice of the Customer tool (Martitz CX, Medallia, Qualtrics)                                 Experience with Advanced Analytics Tools/ language    (R, Python, SQL,etc )                                   Customer Experience Measurement (Tealeaf CEM, Clicktale, QM, Crazyegg)                                 Experience in relevant digital disciplines (e-com, Social, online communities, loyalty programs, CRM, SEO/SEM)                                 Experience with AB and Multi-variate testing tools preferred (e.g. Optimizely, VWO, Test Target)                                     Fluent English both verbally and written                               COURAGE:    Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need.. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things.           TEAMPLAY:    Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset.           INTEGRITY:    Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company s standards.           RESPECT:    Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all.

column2: The ideal candidate will bring a mix of operational experience (running virtual and cross-functional projects), subject matter knowledge (eg, knowledge of the GDPR, UK Data Protection Act) and technical competence (TOM, PIA/DPIA).                Your Impact on the Mission:                 Assist the Global DPO in the management and delivery of the Group Privacy Program;         Assist with the project management and delivery of the Group Privacy Program core initiatives around key elements (timing, budget and resourcing requirements);         Assist the Global DPO in the Training and Awareness strategy implementation;         Assist organizations within the group in maintaining the processing records;         Act as the owner of the group s data processing agreements and monitor third party DD;         Act as the owner of regulatory alignment;         Review PIA s/DPIA s to provide advice on new projects and platforms and services (via One Trust);         Monitor the privacy legislative landscape including SA s and court decisions and trigger change process in the affected documentation;         Serve as Data Protection Officer in certain jurisdictions or liaise with local country Data Protection Officers as applicable;         Working with IT and management to ensure appropriate TOM s are in place;         Act as the contact person for SA s;         Be a part of incident and breach investigations and DSARs as necessary;         Report Group Privacy Program status, plans, risks and KPI s;         Act as an advisor for the enterprise leaders to ensure Group Privacy Program is understood and implemented.               What You ll Bring to The Table:               Bachelor s degree in a relevant field or similar fields;         5+ years of equivalent practical experience;         Working knowledge of international data protection legislation;         Ability to think outside of the box to deliver compliance solutions to internal and external stakeholders in a fast-paced, dynamic global environment;         Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills to effectively work with stakeholders to improve processes and to negotiate priorities;         Experience managing assessments and translating results into business impact and recommendations;         Able to adapt communication style to suit different audiences;         OneTrust certifications or willingness to obtain them quickly;         Fluent English;         IAPP certification(s): CIPP, CIPM, CIPT are strongly preferred;         Experience of working in a multinational company and a complex, matrixed environment is a significant plus.
