column2: The Senior Associate role is a unique opportunity to be on the founding team of startups and partnerships focused on social impact      You will work closely with social leaders, innovators, and entrepreneurs who are addressing some of the world s biggest problems      The Senior Associate will play a critical role in supporting GDI s selection and development of new initiatives with the greatest potential to address persistent global challenges      The Senior Associate will work across the Strategy Build team to research, scope, shape, and prioritize the ideas and partners GDI takes on, as well as further develop initial blueprints into full-blown ventures      The Senior Associate will have the opportunity to landscape, analyze, and develop hypotheses around a wide-range of sectors from youth employment, value-based health care, climate to marginalized populations and beyond            Note: this role will involve significant external consultations with global stakeholders and will require a work schedule that can periodically accommodate calls slightly earlier or later than usual work hours, despite their time zone.        Responsibilities          Strategy Development          Support Strategy Build Directors to execute successful Discover phase work, in which GDI sources, evaluates, and shapes potential opportunities and concepts for incubation.      Lead research, quantitative and qualitative analysis, stakeholder mapping, and market landscaping.      Lead interviews with senior professionals, experts, and other stakeholders.      Ultimately make recommendations for the fit of an initiative to GDI s objectives and services, and support and inform early blueprint development for new initiatives.          Research + Communication          Conduct complex financial, market, and policy analyses.      Track risks, issues, stakeholders, and potential funders.      Support the development and delivery of structured communications, especially reports and presentations.      For initiatives such as GOYN, conduct data analysis and research to inform project design and implementation, including by developing compelling data visualizations and collaborating with initiative teams to analyze and interpret data.          Project Management + Implementation          Support the translation of strategy blueprint into actionable plans, for example by developing, managing, and directly contributing to work plans and budget management.      Support founding teams to deliver key components of Design and Build plans, ranging from early program design, supporting fundraising efforts and piloting to developing organizational infrastructure.      Coordinate consultants and/or service providers, including assisting supervisors in preparation, processing, and administration of consultant and technical services contracts/agreements.      Coordinate support from other GDI teams.      Travel as needed to support implementation, including internationally.      Coordinate and support occasional site visits by GDI Directors and initiative leads.          Donor Engagement          Support the development of concept notes and other fundraising materials.      Review and analyze financial expenditure reports against budgets and donor agreements.      Collect, organize, and prepare program and financial information for donor progress and internal grant management reports, as well as routine queries.          Support to GDI          Brief leadership on a weekly basis as to progress, risks, and issues.      Participate in bi-weekly and quarterly reviews with the GDI leadership team, initiative management team, and advisors.      Contribute to the refinement of incubation methodologies based on your hands-on experiences.      Support broader knowledge management and dissemination.          Undergraduate college degree with 4-8 years of related professional work experience (especially strategy consulting). For a couple of initiatives, experience in the technology space will be preferred.      Demonstrated ability to break down large, complex problems into smaller pieces, develop hypotheses, structure analyses to test these hypotheses, and generate clear insights and actionable recommendations.      Outstanding analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to synthesize quantitative and qualitative data and surface clear, actionable insights for leadership.      For a couple of initiatives such as GOYN, demonstrated experience with data visualization tools and methods will be preferred.      Collaborative team contributor; excellent listening; effective influencer; strong interpersonal skills.      Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; good attention to detail.      Ability to self-manage work streams and tasks; self-directed and resourceful with high standards for quality output.      A curious and creative intellect and a style that includes flexibility, levelness, and a sense of humor and humility.          Qualities of GDI Employees          A relentless drive to get things done.      Curious and entrepreneurial mindset.      Passion for driving social impact and tackling the world s biggest challenges in new ways.

Strong knowledge of EU grants and process preferred. Excellent writing, analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. column2: In this full-time position you will be responsible for requirement gathering, documenting user stories, to design, develop, test, and implement Anaplan models for Vanderlande Industries     You are a skilled Anaplan Model Builder with extensive expertise and a deep understanding of business challenges, especially in the area of Sales & Operations Planning, but more specifically in the area of Supply Chain Planning     This role requires exceptional analytical skills, a strong grasp of supply chain, financial and operational planning and the ability to construct scalable and efficient models in Anaplan     More importantly, you are excellent in stakeholder management, translating business needs seamlessly into functional and technical requirements           Responsibilities          Collaborative stakeholder engagement   : engage with cross-functional teams (ranging from business to IT), understand their requirements and align Anaplan models with business needs. Effectively communicate and manage expectations for successful delivery. Partner with cross functional teams to understand existing Excel models and translate them into efficiently built, dynamic connected Anaplan models where information can be shared across the organization.       Model design and development   : collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, design robust Anaplan models and establish data relationships, hierarchies, and dimensions. Lead Anaplan projects by collaborating with the S&OP team to develop user stories, converting user stories into achievable sprints, and document Anaplan builds. In a later phase, partner with other business units (e.g. Finance, Operations) to design, develop, test, and implement Anaplan solutions. Leverage business process knowledge and expertise in the Anaplan area to drive business process improvements           Model optimization   : continuously enhance the Supply Planning Anaplan model, improving performance, scalability and efficiency. Streamline processes, automate calculations and adhere to best practices.       Data integration   : integrate diverse data sources into Anaplan models, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and integrity through data extraction and transformation.       Complex model building   : develop intricate calculations, formulas, and logic in Anaplan models, supporting supply, financial, sales and operations planning, more specifically: planning, forecasting, budgeting, and scenario analysis.           Testing and quality assurance   : Thoroughly test and validate Anaplan models, ensuring accurate data and resolving any inconsistencies or issues. Proactively evaluate the user experience and system functionality / performance. Identify and document problems uncovered by testing or user feedback, and facilitate correction or refer problems to appropriate personnel for correction.           Documentation management   : create and maintain comprehensive documentation for Anaplan models, including design, mappings, formulas, assumptions and business rules.       User training and support   : provide training, support and user guides to maximize Anaplan model usability. Address user queries and issues promptly.       Continuous learning   : stay updated on new Anaplan features, functionalities, and best practices, expanding knowledge and improving model building skills. Crosstrain across the S&OP team to learn about all aspects of our unique and successful business model.           Product ownership   : understand the technical design, system administration, security, and business management of the Anaplan models, and linkage to other systems and initiatives. Ensure upstream and downstream impacts and dependencies are well understood and communicated to appropriate stakeholders and incorporated into overall project plans           Qualifications        Bachelors degree from a university or equivalent preferred     5+ years of experience in building and maintaining complex Anaplan models, preferably in the area of Sales & Operations Planning (e.g. Rough Cut Capacity Planning, Material Forecasting)     Knows and works according to Anaplan modelling best practices     Preferably a Certified Master Anaplanner     Experience with Financial Planning & Analysis modeling is a plus     Ability to analyze complex business problems and translate them into Anaplan models.     Strong analytical skills to interpret data and provide actionable insights     Understanding of Sales & Operations Planning processes, including demand planning, supply planning, inventory management, and scenario analysis.         Excellent project management skills. Ability to prioritize short-term needs with long-term strategic initiatives while maintaining accuracy, data integrity, and hitting deadlines     Fluent written and spoken English     Excellent communication skills to deal with business stakeholders as well as colleagues from IT and Data & Analytics

column2: You will report to the Director of DMD     You are expected to work in a staggered shift to provide an overlap of at least 4 hours with the US EST time zone     We are looking for an experienced    Analytics Engineer    to join our team and take a leading role in building and optimizing our reporting data architecture     The ideal candidate will be proficient in advanced data modeling techniques within the Snowflake data warehouse using DBT (Data Build Tool) and possess an advanced level of SQL expertise     Additionally, they should have a solid grasp of Python for data exploration and mining insights from complex and disparate data sources     Working as part of the Data, Models, and Decisions (DMD) team, the successful candidate has an opportunity to join an innovative data science and engineering team that s operationalizing data across the organization     We see model-driven processes and workflows as a means to reduce uncertainty, reveal opportunity, and generate operational leverage that collectively create a new dimension of competitive advantage and lay the foundation for new revenue streams                 You will:            Data Architecture Development:    Design, develop, and maintain the reporting data architecture within Snowflake data warehouse using advanced data modeling techniques, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and data integrity.       DBT Implementation:    Utilize DBT (Data Build Tool) to build and automate data pipelines for transformations, streamlining the process of data transformation, cleansing, and enrichment.       Advanced SQL Expertise:    Write complex SQL queries and scripts to extract, transform, and analyze data from various sources, optimizing query performance and ensuring adherence to best practices.       Python Data Exploration:    Leverage Python programming skills to explore and manipulate data, develop custom analytics solutions, and extract actionable insights from large and complex datasets.       Data Mining and Insights:    Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and use data mining techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making and business growth.       Performance Optimization:    Continuously monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines, queries, and processes to ensure timely and accurate delivery of data to reporting and analytics applications.       Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:    Document data architecture, processes, and solutions, and provide training and knowledge sharing sessions to empower other team members with the skills necessary to leverage data effectively.         You have:         5+ years of experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, or a related role, with a focus on building reporting data architecture     5+ years of experience in advanced SQL, with the ability to write complex queries, optimize query performance, and ensure data quality and integrity.     2+ years of hands-on experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) for data transformation and pipeline orchestration.     Strong proficiency in Snowflake data warehouse, including experience with data modeling, performance optimization, and administration.     Proficiency in Python programming for data exploration, manipulation, and analysis.     Experience working with complex and disparate data sources, including structured and unstructured data.     Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.     Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.     Demonstrated ability to independently uncover insights and relationships across numerous datasets     Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or another quantitative field

column2: As a    Data Security Lead   , your role is critical in ensuring the protection and integrity of an organization s data. You will oversee the development, implementation, and management of data security programs, including the following critical components, Hands-on experience with tools like Forcepoint, Varonis, Thales, DSPM, OneTrust, PowerBI       1.    DLP (Data Loss Prevention):    You will be responsible for preventing unauthorized data leaks, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, and safeguarding sensitive information within the organization.     2.    Data Security:    Your role will involve monitoring and securing access to data, detecting abnormal user behavior, and preventing insider threats.     3.    Data Encryption:    You will implement encryption solutions to protect data at rest and in transit to safeguard sensitive data, ensuring confidentiality and integrity.     4.    DSPM (Data Security and Privacy Management):    As a Data Security Manager, you will establish and enforce data security policies, manage data access controls, and ensure compliance with privacy regulations.     5.    Data Access Rights Management:    Your role will involve monitoring, reviewing, and controlling user access to various digital resources within an organization. These resources may include databases, applications, files, folders, and network systems. You will be auditing user access rights to identify any discrepancies or unauthorized access.     6.    Data Privacy:    You will work closely with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to data privacy laws (such as GDPR, CCPA, etc.). This includes managing data subject requests, conducting privacy impact assessments, and maintaining privacy documentation.     7.    Data Analytics:    You will work to transform raw data into meaningful information, and actionable insights, supporting informed decisions, and fostering growth. A few key aspects like Data Collection, Data Cleaning, Data Analysis, Universal Relevance         Key Responsibilities:               Policy Creation:    Develop and enforce policies for effective data management, ensuring adequacy, accuracy, and legitimacy of data.           Secure Procedures:    Implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis, considering technical aspects.           Data Sharing Rules:    Establish rules for data sharing within and outside the organization.           Monitoring and Troubleshooting:    Monitor and analyze information and data systems and troubleshoot data-related issues.           Data Security and Integrity:    Ensure data security and integrity across the organization.           Governance and Project Management:    Overseeing data protection governance for both new and existing initiatives/projects. Keeping stakeholders informed through regular reports on data protection strategies and policies.           Strategy Evaluation:    Assessment of existing data protection strategies and frameworks and Identifying areas for improvement or rectification.             Key Requirements:             Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.         Proven experience in data security management, including DLP, encryption, and access controls.         Familiarity with relevant regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) and industry best practices.         Mandatory certifications CISSP,         Strong technical acumen and problem-solving skills.         Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.         Key Knowledge and Experience:             Leadership skills: Ability to guide and influence teams.         Critical reviewer: Attention to detail and thoroughness.         Data analytics: Proficiency in analysing data.         Power BI: Familiarity with this data visualization tool.         Understanding of Tools: DLP, DSPM, CSPM, Data Classification, Data Encryption, AI and ML.         Knowledge of permissions, user behavior monitoring, and access control.         Awareness of privacy laws and compliance requirements.         Ability to manage data breaches and incidents.         Ability to manage compliance requirements like CIS, NIST, ISO, ISAE etc.         Results-oriented growth mindset with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes.         Excellent verbal and written communication skills.         Excellent relationship-building and negotiating skills.         Ability to manage multiple, critical projects is required.         Years of Experience:         10-15 years of relevant experience in data security management.
column11: Computer science, Data analysis, ISO, Project management, Information security, Relationship building, HIPAA, Data collection, Troubleshooting, Information technology

column2: This position is responsible for developing data-driven solutions to challenging and complex problems related to IT infrastructure/ operations, data ingestion and quality control, and enhancing customer experience     You will also be responsible for consumer credit models, strategies, and business intelligence solutions through consulting engagements and research serving TransUnion and its clients     This position requires understanding consumer lending and credit risk management practices         What you'll Bring:               A work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile.     Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars.     Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.     We provide a modern computing environment based on best-in-class "big data" and cloud computing technologies and the freedom to explore new data sources and statistical and machine learning methodologies.     Our Analytics team is home to some of the most brilliant minds in the market. Here, we will not only understand your stats jokes, well appreciate them.         What you'll bring:         Bachelors (4 year) degree in statistics, applied mathematics, financial mathematics, engineering, operations research, or another highly quantitative field. And, at least five (5) years of professional experience performing advanced analytic work in Financial Services, consumer credit, or a related industry     Strong analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills     Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as Classification, Regression, Clustering, Feature Engineering, Decision Trees, Gradient Boosting etc     Advanced programming skills; proficiency with a statistical language such as R; experience using other programming and data manipulation languages preferred (SQL, Hive, Pig, Python, C/C++, Java); high level of familiarity with Microsoft Office tools     Versatile interpersonal and communication style with the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels within and outside the organization; ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment     Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple assignments effectively     Ability to travel 10-20%       What we'd prefer to see:         Masters or PhD degree in statistics, applied mathematics, financial mathematics, engineering, operations research, or another highly quantitative field. And, at least three (3) years of professional experience performing advanced analytic work in Financial Services, consumer credit, or a related industry     Familiarity with credit bureau data and business practices     Experienced in designing, developing, and deploying consumer credit models for the Financial Services industry     Operates independently in a complex and dynamic, matrixed environment     Experienced working in a company with a global presence     Experience with modern "big data" frameworks (Hadoop, Spark, cloud)       Impact you'll make:             This position is responsible for developing data-driven solutions to challenging and complex problems related to IT infrastructure/ operations, data ingestion and quality control, and enhancing customer experience     You will also be responsible for consumer credit models, strategies, and business intelligence solutions through consulting engagements and research serving TransUnion and its clients     This position requires understanding consumer lending and credit risk management practices     You will partner with internal and external cross-functional teams to drive new business initiatives and deliver long-term value-added product propositions for B2B customers in TransUnions financial services segment. This includes but is not limited to the development of predictive risk management and business intelligence solutions for credit card issuers, auto & mortgage lenders, collections agencies, and retail banks.     You will lead analytic client engagements involving descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive leveraging various techniques (eg, segmentation, logistic regression, machine learning, survival analysis, principal component analysis, Monte Carlo simulation, scenario and sensitivity analysis).     You will design and write programs for data extraction, segmentation, and statistical analysis on large population datasets using languages such as R, Python, SQL, Hive, and Spark on Linux, PC, and other big data computing platforms.     You will deliver analytic insights and recommendations in succinct and compelling presentations for internal and external customers and an executive audience.     You will develop project proposals, sales presentations, and promotional collateral to enable the adoption of integrated customer solutions supported by TransUnion.     You will identify strategies and opportunities for customers to test and adopt TransUnions analytic products and services.     You will provide mentorship and training to junior colleagues and maintain progress on all initiatives under limited direct supervision.     You will foster a high-performance culture and cultivate an environment that promotes excellence and reflects the TransUnion brand

column2: We are seeking a skilled Team Lead with a demonstrated ability to effectively lead teams, particularly in guiding and managing groups of data professionals.        The    Master Data Team Lead    leads a team responsible for managing materials, customers, vendors, business partners, and pricing information in multiple SAP systems, providing critical support to various business functions.   By executing its responsibilities, the Master Data Team Lead ensures that master data quality meets the expectations of stakeholders.             Responsibilities:           Supervise a team of Master Data Administrators, providing guidance, coaching, and training as needed.         Led the maintenance and creation of master data records for materials, customers, vendors, business partners, and pricing in multiple SAP systems.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and enforce data governance standards and policies. column2: As a    Data Security Lead   , your role is critical in ensuring the protection and integrity of an organization s data. You will oversee the development, implementation, and management of data security programs, including the following critical components, Hands-on experience with tools like Forcepoint, Varonis, Thales, DSPM, OneTrust, PowerBI       1.    DLP (Data Loss Prevention):    You will be responsible for preventing unauthorized data leaks, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, and safeguarding sensitive information within the organization.     2.    Data Security:    Your role will involve monitoring and securing access to data, detecting abnormal user behavior, and preventing insider threats.     3.    Data Encryption:    You will implement encryption solutions to protect data at rest and in transit to safeguard sensitive data, ensuring confidentiality and integrity.     4.    DSPM (Data Security and Privacy Management):    As a Data Security Manager, you will establish and enforce data security policies, manage data access controls, and ensure compliance with privacy regulations.     5.    Data Access Rights Management:    Your role will involve monitoring, reviewing, and controlling user access to various digital resources within an organization. These resources may include databases, applications, files, folders, and network systems. You will be auditing user access rights to identify any discrepancies or unauthorized access.     6.    Data Privacy:    You will work closely with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to data privacy laws (such as GDPR, CCPA, etc.). This includes managing data subject requests, conducting privacy impact assessments, and maintaining privacy documentation.     7.    Data Analytics:    You will work to transform raw data into meaningful information, and actionable insights, supporting informed decisions, and fostering growth. A few key aspects like Data Collection, Data Cleaning, Data Analysis, Universal Relevance                 Key Responsibilities:               Policy Creation:    Develop and enforce policies for effective data management, ensuring adequacy, accuracy, and legitimacy of data.       Secure Procedures:    Implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis, considering technical aspects.       Data Sharing Rules:    Establish rules for data sharing within and outside the organization.       Monitoring and Troubleshooting:    Monitor and analyze information and data systems and troubleshoot data-related issues.       Data Security and Integrity:    Ensure data security and integrity across the organization.       Governance and Project Management:    Overseeing data protection governance for both new and existing initiatives/projects. Keeping stakeholders informed through regular reports on data protection strategies and policies.       Strategy Evaluation:    Assessment of existing data protection strategies and frameworks and Identifying areas for improvement or rectification.             Key Requirements:             Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.     Proven experience in data security management, including DLP, encryption, and access controls.     Familiarity with relevant regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) and industry best practices.     Mandatory certifications CISSP,     Strong technical acumen and problem-solving skills.     Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.         Key Knowledge and Experience:             Leadership skills: Ability to guide and influence teams.     Critical reviewer: Attention to detail and thoroughness.     Data analytics: Proficiency in analysing data.     Power BI: Familiarity with this data visualization tool.     Understanding of Tools: DLP, DSPM, CSPM, Data Classification, Data Encryption, AI and ML.     Knowledge of permissions, user behavior monitoring, and access control.     Awareness of privacy laws and compliance requirements.     Ability to manage data breaches and incidents.     Ability to manage compliance requirements like CIS, NIST, ISO, ISAE etc.     Results-oriented growth mindset with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes.     Excellent verbal and written communication skills.     Excellent relationship-building and negotiating skills.     Ability to manage multiple, critical projects is required.         Years of Experience:         10-15 years of relevant experience in data security management.
column11: Computer science, Data analysis, ISO, Project management, Information security, Relationship building, HIPAA, Data collection, Troubleshooting, Information technology

column2: Organizational Overview:  Credit Team decisions credit actions across the lifecycle of a customer  from acquisition to account management to collections and recover  we work towards managing credit and fraud losses and elevating customer experience through powerful and proprietary insights on customer risk and credit behaviours. The actionable insights are driven by access to numerous alternative data sources, new age technologies, focused strategies, emerging algorithms, and predictive precision. Spread across 10 pillars the credit team in India caters to the entire gamut of decision sciences, from data management to model development to strategy design, and bringing it all to life through technology, and managing within the guardrails of our regulatory requirements. As part of the team, you will have access to some unique product propositions, functional and leadership training, interaction with executive leadership team and a myriad of diverse perspectives.  Role Summary/Purpose:  The VP Fraud Strategy Manager will set and drive transactional fraud loss mitigating strategies that meet SYFs strategic vision of leveraging existing and incremental data and advanced analytics to improve the customer experience and improve P & L performance for several portfolios.  Key Responsibilities:   Assume ownership of fraud strategy development efforts certain portfolios   Utilize internal and external data/tools to perform trend identification and work directly with other fraud team members and business leaders to design compensating controls.   Manage transactional fraud strategies in both batch and real-time environments.   Partner with advanced modeling teams to drive targeting/treatment solutions that meet business objectives   Drive enhancements to differentiate the core fraud loss mitigation strategies across strategic portfolio segments that leverages the unique aspects of those segments.   Partner with strategy optimization role to ensure strategy actions meet SYF financial commitments and risk appetite   Work with finance team/PCMs team to ensure strategies are driving the desired P & L impacts   Strategy owners are ultimately responsible for the ongoing effectiveness and monitoring of their strategies. As such this role will develop the framework for how we monitor, measure and report the results of our strategies to business   Provide swift actions to combat immediate fraud attacks, and proactively prevent future such attacks  Required Skills/Knowledge:   Bachelors/Masters degree with 8+ years of experience in building analytically derived strategies with in Credit, Marketing, Risk or Collections in Financial services, or in lieu of a degree 10+ years of experience.   Minimum 3 years experience in Authorization Strategy or Fraud Strategy Development or Implementation   Minimum 3 years??Project Management experience   Minimum 2 years??experience with operational and regulatory risk, and governance   Demonstrated expert proficiency with SAS and/or SQL programming especially Data Extractions and ensuring data quality   Expert level proficiency with Excel  Desired Skills/Knowledge:   Degree in Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Business, or Statistics strongly preferred.   Master's Degree desired   Excellent communication skills and experience with interacting successfully at all levels within the RCF organization.   Outstanding collaborative and team management style.   Ability to multitask and perform in a fast paced environment   Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills.   International fraud/consumer finance experience a plus.   Experience with CDCI, RAMS, PDR and CLBP2 database a plus   Proven ability to work with data sources, data warehouses and database tools.   Proven ability to successfully manage and implement projects on time & on budget.   Proven ability to communicate with all levels of employees, management and clients.  Eligibility Criteria:  Bachelor??/Master?? degree with 8+ years of experience in building analytically derived strategies with in Credit, Marketing, Risk or Collections in Financial services, or in lieu of a degree 10+ years of experience Work Timings:  This role qualifies for Enhanced Flexibility and Choice offered in Synchrony India and will require the incumbent to be available between 06:00 AM Eastern Time ??11:30 AM Eastern Time (timings are anchored to US Eastern hours and will adjust twice a year locally). This window is for meetings with India and US teams. The remaining hours will be flexible for the employee to choose. Exceptions may apply periodically due to business needs.

column2: This position is remote, where you have the option to work from home. On occasion we may request for you to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events. To ensure the safety of our colleagues and communities, we require employees who come together in-person to be fully vaccinated. Were proud to offer you choice and flexibility.  Organizational Overview:  Synchrony's Risk Team is a dynamic and innovative team dedicated to provide oversight as 2nd Line of Defense. Risk Team oversees and manages the Risk Program in order to support the business in anticipating and addressing risks, issues and challenges. Results are consistent with the respective strategic uses and complying with related Overall Risk / Risk Testing policies, standards, procedures as well as regulations. This role is aligned to Enterprise Risk- Risk Testing analytics & requires high level of expertise with data & analytics - minimal technical supervision to effectively contribute to projects.  Role Summary/Purpose:  The selected candidate will be a L10-AVP on the Risk Analytics Team in India, that rolls up into Synchrony Financial India. The candidate will be responsible for using analytics and innovation to develop data driven solutions that yield efficiencies and enhanced effectiveness across the organization. This role will also be responsible for becoming a functional expert, while collaborating with Synchrony Process Owners including VP and SVP levels. The candidate is also responsible for building partnerships with various US stakeholders.  Key Responsibilities:   Develop, lead, collaborate, manage, communicate, and influence data driven solutions and results primarily with the Risk Testing Team, but may support the other analytics pillars that include Compliance, Operational Risk and First Line Process Oversight.   Identify how to measure control design and effectiveness, and review CTCs; interpret its meaning and its analytics scope by leveraging internal Data warehouses   Ability to work independently and able to perform technical code validations periodically   Collaborate and engage with all levels of management including Senior Leaders across all sites to drive analytics-based process improvements, insights, thought leadership and actions.   Become a data SME and an Analytics Athlete that includes end-to-end functional learning, leveraging most data warehouses and applying the necessary tools for each solution that includes visualization, machine learning, speech analytics and data mining.  Innovate data driven solutions independently with enterprise-wide customers across both the first and second lines of defense by leveraging the latest analytical tools and technologies.   Problem solving through analytics to bring value-add efficiencies to our customers that include solutions involving automation, visualization, analytical insight, and machine learning.   Effectively engage with customers to de-risk Synchrony through analytical oversight and review of end-to-end processes utilizing data and effective challenge to ensure key objectives and risks are accurately connected in a meaningful manner.   Engage in storytelling with the data output that will create a comprehensive view on what the data means including identified actions.   Interact and present key data driven updates and initiatives to the stakeholders and regulators.   Participate in the Risk Engagement Strategy process that will develop and drive improvements across the Risk Team   Drive projects with minimum guidance  Required Skills/Knowledge:   Bachelors degree with minimum of 4+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry or in lieu of Degree, 6+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry.   4 years of Hands on working knowledge of SAS, SQL , Tableau   Ability to interact with all levels of Leadership and collaborative across teams and functions   Strong written/oral communication skills.   Proven ability to deliver Analytical solutions for Business problems  Desired Skills/Knowledge:   Ability to validate first line control framework as part of the Risk testing.   Knowledge of Credit Card/Consumer Finance products and Risk analytics experience   Ability to work on simultaneous multiple projects, organize work flow, and prioritize work assignments while being in different time zones.   Experience in people and project management, including demonstrated ability to develop actionable plan to meet high level objectives, strong execution, and timeline sensitive deliverables.   Experience of working in a matrix organization with multiple stakeholders.   Sharp focus on accuracy with extreme attention to detail.  Eligibility Criteria:  Bachelors degree with minimum of 4+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry or in lieu of Degree, 6+ years of experience in financial Risk services or banking/Credit card industry.  Work Timings: 1:00 PM IST to 11:00 PM IST

column2: Star Sports is the leading sports broadcaster in India. It offers a wide variety of sports content, broadcasting all major sports events such as IPL, ICC, Premier League, Pro Kabaddi, Wimbledon etc. Star Sports has redefined sports broadcasting in India with extensive cricket coverage, including domestic and international matches. It also offers several regional channels in different languages to cater to the diverse linguistic audience in India. We serve high quality content to millions of customers with world class technology and production. Analytics plays a key role in the world of sports broadcast across live matches, shows and non-live programming. Disney Star has been the pioneer in data-driven storytelling in the world of sports broadcast. The Live Analytics Manager will be working with the Executive Producers to lead and drive the analytics-based stories across Live Beyond Live Programming.           Key Responsibilities:     Oversee the identification, conceptualisation, producing and packaging of analytical stories on for all matches, live shows, and the surround shows.   Lead Senior Producers to deliver high quality content across live beyond live programming.   Ideate and plan content analytical editorial thrust for the various series/tournaments in advance.   Lead the development of analytical sports editorial acumen to storytelling across properties.   Oversee to ensure the identification and preparation of archival overlays for the upcoming series/events.   Collaborate and drive synergies with all key cross-functions partners in the internal and external editorial production eco-system.   Ensure that the Product across Live Non-Live is of supreme quality that resonates with the target audience.           Performance Measures:     Success of the production through consumption measures, not restricted to TVR TSV ratings alone. column2: Driving traffic analytics at adidas e-commerce, you are responsible for delivering cutting-edge Analytical services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions      Based on internal & external data sources, you manage the creation and generation of tools, data capabilities, optimizations and insights that help adidas better understand the consumer, expand reach, increase customer engagement and advocacy, and ultimately drive traffic, conversion and sales      In collaboration with your team, you drive and execute planning and analytics strategy and services across Emerging Markets focusing on Digital Marketing Analytics, Traffic & Media measurement and optimization, working closely with e-com and Brand Activation team              Key Responsibilities:            Digital Marketing Analytics        :          Drive EM e-com traffic analytics (all level of macro and micro KPIs) for our Website, Apps and Digital Platforms / eMarketplaces.          Own and drive consolidation, measurement of results and optimization of traffic generation and related conversion and ROI/ROAS, aligning and developing a global-aligned reporting framework that evaluates dimensions such as awareness, engagement and purchasing behavior. Provide insights about adidas brand awareness and e-commerce performance.          Collaborate and support Performance Marketing Brand team, Digital Brand Activations team and e-com UX and CE teams to achieve the Premium Shopping Experience value proposition and relevant Personalization across all digital touch points, to support enhancements to traffic generation, site usability, content, marketing, and overall customer experience.          Closely collaborate with the e-com forecasting team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep-dives for e-com channel forecasts, campaigns and pre-post mortems, traffic acquisition strategies & overall business objectives.          Conduct collection, tracking, mining and analysis of data and generation of fact-based insights, using a single data source.          Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of e-com organic and paid media traffic.          Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization.          Monitor and analyze market trends and competitor activities and derive conclusions for the growth and optimization of adidas digital traffic generation activities.          Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through application of the full set of advanced analysis methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modeling.          Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered KPIs analysis and insights. Drive the translation of gathered insights into engaging, actionable and easy to digest insights presentation and implementations to ensure KPIs gaps, risks and uplift are closed and targets are achieved.          Implement analytics tools/reporting framework within e-commerce to facilitate every decision maker access to the information needed in the shape needed dashboards, visualization tools, reports etc.          Support execution of online campaigns through effective analytics focusing on uncovering trends in traffic, KPIs, customer behavior and sales          Ensure tools and systems daily routines & activities, refresh, updates and scheduling. Build a strong internal and external network, informing the adidas Digital Analytics community on the latest trends and technological advances. Experience in or familiarity with analytics platforms, especially in their integration or deriving insights requiring multiple sources          Industry: Ideally in apparel/fashion/shoes or internet          Knowledge & Soft Skills    :        Deep knowledge of Digital and e-com analytics          Ability to efficiently work in a cross-functional organization, ability to develop influential and collaborative relationships with stakeholders from digital and non-digital disciplines on all levels          Excellent communication & negotiation skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to technical and non-technical audience both in person and remotely at various organizational levels          A passion for designing and creating new data capabilities, tools, and frameworks. Meticulous, high attention to details          Creative and energetic team player who has a passion for delivering analytics, data, insights to drive outcomes for quantifiable improvements in business results and consumer satisfaction. column2: Driving traffic analytics at adidas e-commerce, you are responsible for delivering cutting-edge Analytical services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions. Based on internal & external data sources, you manage the creation and generation of tools, data capabilities, optimizations and insights that help adidas better understand the consumer, expand reach, increase customer engagement and advocacy, and ultimately drive traffic, conversion and sales. In collaboration with your team, you drive and execute planning and analytics strategy and services across Emerging Markets focusing on Digital Marketing Analytics, Traffic & Media measurement and optimization, working closely with e-com and Brand Activation team.                           Key Responsibilities:                                Digital Marketing Analytics                   :                                 Drive EM e-com traffic analytics (all level of macro and micro KPIs) for our Website, Apps and Digital Platforms / eMarketplaces.                                  Own and drive consolidation, measurement of results and optimization of traffic generation and related conversion and ROI/ROAS, aligning and developing a global-aligned reporting framework that evaluates dimensions such as awareness, engagement and purchasing behavior. Provide insights about adidas brand awareness and e-commerce performance.                                 Collaborate and support Performance Marketing Brand team, Digital Brand Activations team and e-com UX and CE teams to achieve the Premium Shopping Experience value proposition and relevant Personalization across all digital touch points, to support enhancements to traffic generation, site usability, content, marketing, and overall customer experience.                                 Closely collaborate with the e-com forecasting team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep-dives for e-com channel forecasts, campaigns and pre-post mortems, traffic acquisition strategies & overall business objectives.                                 Conduct collection, tracking, mining and analysis of data and generation of fact-based insights, using a single data source.                                 Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of e-com organic and paid media traffic.                                 Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization.                                 Monitor and analyze market trends and competitor activities and derive conclusions for the growth and optimization of adidas digital traffic generation activities.                                 Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through application of the full set of advanced analysis methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modeling.                                 Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered KPIs analysis and insights. Drive the translation of gathered insights into engaging, actionable and easy to digest insights presentation and implementations to ensure KPIs gaps, risks and uplift are closed and targets are achieved.                                  Implement analytics tools/reporting framework within e-commerce to facilitate every decision maker access to the information needed in the shape needed dashboards, visualization tools, reports etc.                                  Support execution of online campaigns through effective analytics focusing on uncovering trends in traffic, KPIs, customer behavior and sales                                 Ensure tools and systems daily routines & activities, refresh, updates and scheduling.                                 Support deep-dives, ad-hoc analysis and contextual dashboards with relevant platforms and channels.                                  Develop and maintain a strong stakeholder network with high level of trust that facilitates action- ability of insights.                                 Advise stakeholders in your area of responsibility on digital analytics to define goals, select appropriate KPIs, monitor performance and derive trends and opportunities.                                 Keep the continuous development of the analytics practice in scope, including service portfolio evolution and constant screening of the ecosystem for new models, capabilities, partners or solutions.                                 Build a strong internal and external network, informing the adidas Digital Analytics community on the latest trends and technological advances.                               Requirements :                                                                 Degree with focus in Business, Finance, Economics, Math, Data Science or related field preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience                                 Minimum 3-5 years of experience working in Digital Analytics, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Demand forecasting & planning, Data Science or equivalent experience                                     Advanced experience with digital marketing in a brand environment                                         Functional knowledge of e-commerce content, search engine optimization/marketing, user experience, analytics, core e-Commerce capabilities, CRM process/program, and overlaps/opportunities in relation to behavioral web data                                         Experience in traffic generation, in-house or at a leading traffic agency.                                     Experience in or familiarity with analytics platforms, especially in their integration or deriving insights requiring multiple sources                                 Industry: Ideally in apparel/fashion/shoes or internet                                  Knowledge & Soft Skills           :                                Deep knowledge of Digital and e-com analytics                                 Ability to efficiently work in a cross-functional organization, ability to develop influential and collaborative relationships with stakeholders from digital and non-digital disciplines on all levels                                 Excellent communication & negotiation skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to technical and non-technical audience both in person and remotely at various organizational levels                                 A passion for designing and creating new data capabilities, tools, and frameworks. Interest in back-of-house development of analytics capabilities. Devotion to accuracy, reliability, rigor, and user-focused design.                                 Meticulous, high attention to details                                 Creative and energetic team player who has a passion for delivering analytics, data, insights to drive outcomes for quantifiable improvements in business results and consumer satisfaction.                                 Broad understanding of and passion for the sports and fashion/entertainment industry                                 Hard Skills               :                                Advanced experience in Digital Analytics, BI, Financial, Digital tools                                 Hands-on experience with analytics, statistics, data visualization, and analytics tools and disciplines                                 Proficient in MS Office (with an emphasis on Excel), Alteryx or at least one querying language                                 Experience with process design and process improvements, automation, etc.                                 Proven project management skills, including the ability to lead projects or work on several projects simultaneously.                     Plus would be considered:                     Experience in forecasting and predictive models                                 Advanced experience with Analytics Blending & Visualization Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Alteryx, SQL )                                 Advanced experience with traffic analytics tools, marketing & media KPIs and ROI                                 Advanced experience with reporting and digital marketing tools (GA 360, doubleclick, Adobe Analytics, SCV, propensity modelling etc).                                 Advanced experience Experience with Web Analytics and Native app (iOS/Android) analytics (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Webtrends, Wetrekk, Amplitude, AppsFlyer, FireBase ).                                 Experience with Voice of the Customer tool (Martitz CX, Medallia, Qualtrics)                                 Experience with Advanced Analytics Tools/ language    (R, Python, SQL,etc )                                   Customer Experience Measurement (Tealeaf CEM, Clicktale, QM, Crazyegg)                                 Experience in relevant digital disciplines (e-com, Social, online communities, loyalty programs, CRM, SEO/SEM)                                 Experience with AB and Multi-variate testing tools preferred (e.g. Optimizely, VWO, Test & Target)                                     Fluent English both verbally and written

column2: Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Power BI Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Power BI, DAX, SQL, and DevOps, with a proven track record of creating insightful and visually appealing dashboards for financial, warehouse and operational purposes. As a Power BI Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions that enable data-driven decision-making across the organization. Role & responsibilities     Develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights into key business metrics and performance indicators. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications for Power BI solutions. Design and implement data models using DAX and SQL to support the visualization of complex datasets. Create templates for financial and operational dashboards in Warehouse managment that can be easily customized and scaled across the business. Optimize Power BI reports and queries for performance and scalability, ensuring timely and reliable access to data. Work closely with the DevOps team to deploy and manage Power BI solutions in production environments, adhering to best practices for security and governance. Provide training and support to end users on how to effectively use Power BI for data analysis and reporting. Utilize dbt (Data Build Tool) to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring data consistency and reliability for reporting purposes. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in Power BI, dbt, Snowflake, and related technologies, and proactively recommend enhancements to our BI infrastructure.  Proficient in GitHub for version control, collaboration, and project management, including repository management, pull requests, code reviews, issue tracking, CI/CD integration, and documentation  Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. 8 to 12 years of experience working as a Power BI Developer or Business Intelligence Analyst. Proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, Power Pivot, and Power View. Strong understanding of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and SQL for data modelling and manipulation. Experience with DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD). Familiarity with dbt (Data Build Tool) for data transformation and modeling. Experience working with Snowflake or other cloud-based data warehouses. Solid understanding of data visualization best practices and principles. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Certification in Power BI,dbt, Snowflake, or related technologies is a plus. Perks and benefits
column11: Dax Queries, Power Bi Dashboards, Data Visualization, Snowflake, SQL Queries, Data Modeling

column2: Pipeline Project Management - DDAP is looking to hire a dedicated Analytics Development Lead to deliver fit for purpose analysis, reports and visualizations dedicated to PPM ambitions     This is crucial for successful R&D project pipeline progression and delivery     The Analytics Development Lead is responsible for delivery of the strategic roadmap for DDAP Analytics by partnering with analytics managers, data governance lead, tech leads and analytics consumers     This role will provide strategic leadership opportunity to architect, build, and deploy analytics ecosystem     The position will involve direct line management and development of analytics developers     The Analytics Development Lead is directly accountable for providing consistent, simple, efficient and sustainable analytics and reporting infrastructure related to PPM and will be the business point of reference for those topics and issues             Key Responsibilities             Contribute to the development of analytics strategy & architecture in partnering with tech leads and R&D control tower owners. Thinking forward to design for the future (2-3 years+) technology and analytical needs of the group in addition to those of today.     Own the delivery of the fit for purpose architecture and processes supporting DDAP - Analytics vision.     Develop solution blueprint and architecture specification for evolving business processes in PPM.     Develop structured partnership with analytics consumers, analytics managers, tech leads and R&D control towers to bring alignment across analytics development process and consistency in reporting.     Building technology-based solutions which are optimised to workflows. Analyse and codify the analytical requirements; identify and analyse alternative solutions and develop project charters. Work closely with stakeholders in an agile environment to ensure successful and timely delivery of product releases, including prioritization, sprint planning, and backlog management through negotiation and agreement. column2: Role Overview : As a Data Migration Specialist within the insurance industry in the UK, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless migration of data from Azure SQL to Salesforce platform. This position demands a strong technical acumen in Azure SQL along with exceptional communication skills to effectively liaise with various stakeholders including Business Analysts (BAs) based in London, project managers, and the insurance company's integration partner.  The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the entire data migration process, ensuring data integrity, and facilitating smooth communication between all parties involved. Key Responsibilities : Data Migration Planning and Execution : Lead the planning and execution of data migration activities from Azure SQL to Salesforce platform. Technical Expertise : Demonstrate proficiency in Azure SQL to efficiently extract, transform, and load (ETL) data into Salesforce. Stakeholder Communication : Act as a primary point of contact for stakeholders including BAs, project managers, and integration partners, ensuring clear and effective communication throughout the migration process. Data Integrity and Quality Assurance : Implement measures to maintain data integrity during migration and conduct thorough quality assurance checks to validate the accuracy of migrated data. Issue Resolution : Identify and address any technical issues or challenges encountered during the migration process in a timely manner, collaborating with relevant stakeholders to find effective solutions. Documentation and Reporting : Maintain comprehensive documentation of data migration processes, including migration plans, technical specifications, and issue logs. Generate regular progress reports for stakeholders and project teams. Required Skills and Qualifications : Proficiency in Azure SQL : Extensive experience working with Azure SQL databases, including data extraction, transformation, and loading processes. Salesforce Migration Experience : Previous experience in migrating data to Salesforce platform would be highly advantageous. Strong Communication Skills : Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively engage with stakeholders at various levels and communicate technical concepts in a clear and concise manner. Project Management Skills : Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously, adhering to project timelines and deadlines. Analytical Thinking : Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to identify and resolve technical issues during data migration. Attention to Detail : Meticulous attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and integrity throughout the migration process. Team Collaboration : Proven ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams and build positive working relationships with colleagues and stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications :  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.  Relevant certifications in Azure SQL or Salesforce. Location - Hyderabad,ahmedabad,pune,chennai,kolkata.
column11: Data Migration, Azure, Data Integrity, Data Mining, ETL, SQL, Salesforce

Experience with analyzing and visualizing large volumes and multi-tenant of data using CRM Analytics (Tableau CRM).          Experience with crafting and managing dataflows/recipes and setting up Tableau CRM apps, datasets, Sharing, and Security predicates.          Experience with building/maintaining dashboards and working with bindings, connect data sources from other Salesforce and non-Salesforce Systems. Knowledgeable in standard functions/ modules of Salesforce: Sales and Service Objects and their relationships in Salesforce.          Strong knowledge of Salesforce design principles, technically scalable data modeling and data access security controls. column2: Role purpose: The Radical Simplification & Automation team with VOIS acts as the Centre of Excellence to drive the digital and automation transformation path for Vodafone Markets. This is a critical function to move Vodafone Markets from a transaction-based operation to a highly automated insight- and data-driven organization. The Business Automation Lead role will involve working with Product Owners, business users and functional / technical experts to translate business opportunities into a high-level technical analytics and automation solutions. Key aspects of the role:  Work with Product Owners, business users and functional / technical experts to translate business opportunities into a high level, technical, analytics and automation solutions. Act as the interface between the Product Owner and Solution Architecture / Design to document requirements and user stories. Contribute to business case quantification. column1: Sr Principal, Quantitative Analytics and Data Science
column2: The Senior Principal is a managerial position India B&D CoE. The selected incumbent will be part of the India B&D team managing quant researchers addressing cutting-edge strategic issues facing today s senior-most functional executives at leading global corporations.     Senior Principal will lead a team of 4 to 6 quantitative researchers responsible for conducting surveys, collecting, and analyzing data, creating data-based reports for clients, and generating data-based insights. The content you and your team create will serve the needs of CXO s and their teams operating globally.              ?       What you will do:            Design standardized data reports for clients that help them understand internal gaps as well as allow them to benchmark themselves against their peers.         Communicate and present analytical insights to clients and internal stakeholders that include senior practice leaders, subject matter experts and advisors.         Lead and promote best practice in design, execution, process & delivery of diagnostic and benchmarking products.         Own end-to-end creation, development, and analysis of large, complex, disparate data sets to identify actionable insights for senior executives.           Manage Benchmarking and Diagnostic product life cycle to increase utilization including:           Manage all aspects of in-life products, including customer feedback, requirements, and issues.         Develop the collateral and sales tools that support the selling process.         Providing vison for product life cycle.             Manage, nurture, and develop a team of diagnostic and benchmarking managers.         Build scalable team structures and processes - Create career paths and provide growth opportunities for high performers.         Manage quality and productivity of the teams projects, triage requests as appropriate, and manage day-to-day operations of the central team.         Provide thought leadership and mentorship to junior team members related to all aspects of fulfillment including survey design, administration, client walkthroughs, and insight generation.         Develop a First Team culture - work closely with peer managers to build trust, encourage teamwork and identify synergies to capitalize for highest impact.               What you will need:           MBA or a Postgraduate Degree from a recognized premier Institute in disciplines with a strong analytics component, including Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Econometrics, Applied Microeconomics.         Minimum 8-10 years of experience at a leading survey-based research or consulting firm or as a practitioner who has played significant role in finance, operations, or procurement.         At least 18 months managerial experience with direct or indirect supervision responsibilities.               Who you are:        ?     We are looking for creative, analytically strong, articulate and self-motivated individuals who would like to develop a strong knowledge of the terrain along with building consultative problem-solving skills. Unlike management consulting, investment banking, or law, our strategic research positions do not depend on a special appetite or aptitude for sales or business development. Our search for talent is centered, without exception, on the ability to run deep on a logical, philosophical, or economic problem and resurface with rigorous original insight.      ?       Some of the shared characteristics of our successful hires include:           Desire and ability to assume a leadership role in a collaborative, fast-paced multi-cultural environment.         Experience working with survey-based data including management of surveys, benchmarking data and or panel surveys, conducting quantitative analysis, managing benchmarking surveys.         Should have strong project management experience demonstrating the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.         People management skills - Managing teams in a matrix reporting environment.         Good oral and written communication skills a must for this role.               What we offer:           Competitive base salary             Great on job learning             A great work culture

column2: The Quantitative Research Principal is an individual contribution role with who works closely with researchers, advisors and senior most functional executives     to identify and produce research that solves complex business challenges on a global scale     This position is for experienced researchers with a knack for product management who are interested in conducting quantitative research, analysis and reporting using proprietary data derived from the diagnostic and benchmarking products they manage     Quantitative team members enjoy exposure to the full array of data related work: data management and quality; designing research and benchmarking surveys; statistical modeling; quantitative insight generation and some exposure to advanced data management tools and techniques focused on peeling apart ideas in search of insight                 What you ll do           Engage executives from Fortune 500- and mid-sized companies to identify their most pressing business challenges and translate research and survey results into actionable recommendations that clients can implement.     Lead and promote best practice in design, execution, process delivery of diagnostic and benchmarking products.     Communicating and presenting analytical insights to internal stakeholders and clients.     Use python coding to automate assessment reports for Gartner Clients.     Product manage and work directly with clients on deploying proprietary Gartner diagnostic and benchmarking products.     Walk clients through the entire value chain system of benchmarking and diagnostic products.     Convert research and data analysis results into clear narratives and visually compelling presentations designed to teach ideas to clients and stakeholders.               What you ll need           Masters (preferred) with 5-7 years experience, preferably in an analytics-heavy field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Policy Analysis, etc.);       Or    Bachelor's degree with 6-9 years experience, preferably in an analytics-heavy field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics etc.);     Experience in research and project management experience as well as experience in analyzing quantitative and qualitative data to identify relevant findings     Experience with data management, data cleaning, and data merging and appending     Expertise in statistics - descriptives, bivariate, linear and logistic regression     Experience in designing research survey questionnaires and creating graphical representations of data     Experience in directly working with clients     Python expertise is a must     Expertise with a statistical/coding package (R, SPSS, etc.) for advanced analytics (e.g., multi-variate regressions, logistic regressions, cluster analysis, factor analysis, etc.) required               Who you are           Confident communicator with the ability to teach and relay ideas to others     A creative thinker with excellent problem-solving abilities     An expert in the relevant, practical application of survey design methods and expert in python     Enjoy working independently as well as part of a team     Expert in statistics     Results-oriented with a keen attention to detail

column2: Duration: 12 Months  Stipend: 50000/m  About the Role: We're searching for a talented and motivated Growth Hacking Specialist specializing in prospecting to join our team. As a key driver of lead generation, this role focuses on identifying and leveraging new growth opportunities to increase our customer base. Using a mix of innovative tactics, data analytics, and digital tools, you'll play a pivotal role in strategic outreach and refining the prospecting processes to enhance ROI and boost business growth. Key Responsibilities:   Develop and implement creative growth hacking strategies to identify new opportunities and generate high-quality leads. Conduct data-driven analysis to uncover growth trends, evaluate campaign performance, and refine outreach tactics. Utilize digital tools, automation platforms, and emerging technologies to optimize lead      generation efforts. Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to align growth hacking initiatives with overall business objectives. Continuously experiment with new approaches, from social media marketing to email campaigns and content marketing, to improve prospecting processes. Analyze customer behavior and segment markets to tailor strategies for maximum engagement and conversion. Monitor and report on key metrics to measure the impact of growth hacking initiatives and provide insights for future improvements. Who You Are: Innovative thinker with a  creative approach to problem-solving and growth. Strong analytical skills with experience in data-driven marketing and a proactive approach to leveraging insights. Tech-savvy, with proficiency in marketing automation tools, and data analytics software. Detail-oriented, able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment. Passionate about growth marketing and eager to explore new ways to expand the customer base. Why Join Us: Be at the forefront of growth marketing and learn from experienced professionals in the field. Make a significant impact on the company's growth trajectory and business success. Work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where innovation is encouraged. Enjoy professional development opportunities and mentorship to advance your career.

column2: SVB India is a global delivery center for SVB, the financial partner of the innovation economy and parent of Silicon Valley Bank. SVB India develops products and provides services in finance, banking operations, and technology, and employs more than 800 employees and will be rapidly expanding. Learn more at https://svb.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/svbankindia.  Job location   Bangalore  Be Part Of a Bank Like No Other.  When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference.   Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work.   For 35 years, SVB Financial Group (NASDAQ SIVB) and its subsidiaries have helped innovative companies and their investors move ambitious ideas forward, fast. SVB Financial Groups businesses, including Silicon Valley Bank, operate at the intersection of innovation and capital, and provide a comprehensive range of financial services including commercial banking, investment solutions, research and insights, funds management and private banking and wealth advisory. SVB helps high growth companies in the technology, life science and healthcare, private equity and venture capital, and premium wine industries navigate at every stage. In addition, the company focuses on encouraging positive relationships with firms within the private equity and venture capital community worldwide, many of which are also the firm's clients and may invest in the firm's corporate clients.
