column2: Description: Boyd's Sales Operations Analyst mission is to enable data backed decision making. Our team wants a candidate who is interested in changing the way our company does business from the inside out. You will own corporate & executive internal reporting. Provide actionable insights and visibility to global business trends. Work will be organized into daily, weekly, monthly reporting deliverables and often require additional deep dives into certain KPIs where executives may have additional questions or need further insights. You will play a critical role in delivering world class go to market (GTM) reporting to all team members of the sales and GTM organization.  Shift Timing : 2:00 PM to 11:00 PM Role Description: Identify gaps & provide recommendations for data quality improvements including process changes & data cleansing (ETL). Work closely with leadership and sales team to identify systems, data, or process needs that can drive revenue growth; with a goal of streamlining the sales process. Drive process improvement initiatives. Identify gaps and conduct feedback sessions with sales representatives to improve sales. Manage system data and other integrations. Understand the Account Management, Opportunity Management & Pipeline forecasting. Support and improve the pipeline metrics insights and reporting. Support and produce weekly, monthly, and quarterly sales reporting deliverables to the organization. Owning and executing the corrections required out of the reconciliation of reports. Administration and support of system application, timely resolution of requests. Ability to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose & respond to issues and requests. Analyze and develop sales operations policies and procedures for better sales optimization. Engage with the sales team to identify opportunities for improvement and conversions. Develop and own standard sales reporting that provides transparency into the business, and proactively identify risks and opportunities to our sustained revenue growth Aptitude for framing business questions with data, translating business needs into strategies, and executing tactics and process improvements. Take charge as a primary liaison on sales force automation projects/trends. Ensure everyday sales operation tasks are aligned with organizations sales goals and objectives Recognize patterns in data and devise unconventional out-of-the-box solutions for each step of the sales funnel Examine past data and previous trends to help the sales function with identifying any issues with the existing sales process, pipeline, and metrics while finding the best solutions. Key Requirements: Ability to communicate in English both written and verbal. Working experience in B2B product workspace preferably as Sales Operation Analyst. In-depth understanding of multiple functions, such as product management, marketing, and data management, data analytics, etc. Proven ability to manage large sets of data, analyze and derive insights-based sales operation metrics. Technical expertise with CRMs, business intel platforms, and data modelling/Data Visualization is a bonus! Ability to work with cross-functional and cross-cultural teams as you will act as an advocate for the sales team in many instances. We are a global company, and you may be required to work with different team members in different time zones and locales. Ability to work in varied shift arrangements. Nice to Have: experience with contracts, user provisioning and/or order to cash process Nice to Have: experience with Salesforce.com or another like CRM system

column2: You will be joining KYC (Know Your Client) Operations, supporting the Corporate and Investment Bank functions of Deutsche Bank.      In playing an integral role in the banks first line of defence against financial crime, KYC Operations works closely with the Business and Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) in subjecting new and existing clients to reviews against standards reflecting externally defined requirements and internally established policy.      The Data/MI function within KYC Operations accesses rich data stores in providing global/regional management information to senior management, the Business, operations teams for planning, steering and review, as well as regulators and internal control functions, both ad hoc and on a regular basis.      As a Data Scientist, your experience and expertise will be key in building and refining optimal data sourcing processes, maintaining a data provisioning service to our portfolio of dashboards, delivering analytics solutions, and informing wider decision making              What we ll offer you          As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you ll enjoy        Best in class leave policy      Gender neutral parental leaves      100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)      Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education      Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members      Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents      Accident and Term life Insurance      Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above                Your key responsibilities            Maintain and enhance portfolio of existing analytics/reporting services      Migrating tactically developed processes to recognized analytics platforms      Refine regionally disparate reporting processes in designing harmonized global service      Deliver RTB reporting solutions within SLA thresholds          Supporting demand for new analytical output      Consider demand against existing portfolio of reporting solutions for optimally efficient integration      Ensure requirements meet minimum standards for acceptance      Agree prioritisation and delivery schedule in partnership with management and requestor/sponsor          Task scoping and requirements refinement - alignment of requirements through consultation with manager and service requestor      End to end development of prioritised reporting solutions - retaining    ownership/responsibility    for technical delivery of all assigned reporting/analytics tasks      Use data modelling tools to develop easily repeatable processes, maximising automation opportunity for efficient regular processing (or simple process reconfiguration where needed)      Determine/confirm most effective tooling for solution delivery (factors may include: time to market, existing strategic/tactical services, )      Develop solution in appropriate platform, based on proof-of-concept basis - Tableau) preferred      Ability to tailor analysis and communication to engage effectively with multiple potential stakeholders (e.g. senior management, Production teams, regulators, ) at various levels of the corporate hierarchy, across a range of global locations      Capable of accommodating multiple simultaneous tasks effectively and operating to tight schedules      Can operate autonomously, having established with management the necessary parameters informing delivery approach      Effective communicator who can exemplify DB s Speak Up culture      Honours degree expected, ideally in Computer Science or similar      Some experience with / an understanding of KYC processes and data is beneficial but not essential                How we ll support you            Training and development to help you excel in your career      Coaching and support from experts in your team      A culture of continuous learning to aid progression      A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

column2: As an Analytics Engineer at Vanderlande youll be at the forefront of driving data-driven solutions and shaping the future of our organization by working on the data platform. Your key responsibilities will involve translating business needs into functional requirements, designing and developing data products, pipelines, and reports, and analyzing data to solve use cases resulting in optimized business processes and fact-based decision-making.         As being part of a cross functional full-stack team, together with your colleagues you are responsible for the creation and delivery of an end-to-end solution to our business stakeholders. In this role, you are a tech-savvy, action-oriented, and collaborative colleague who can wear multiple hats - part Data Engineer, - part Data Analyst and even though you have an area of expertise, you can fulfil each of those roles up to a certain point.         On a day-to-day basis, you will focus on creating and maintaining data products, data pipelines using Python, PySpark and SQL, and dashboards using tools like Qlik, or Power BI. Working in an Agile environment, proactively contributes to scrum events ensuring seamless coordination with the team and swift adaptability to changing priorities. They thrive in a fast-paced, iterative development environment, where constant feedback and continuous improvement are key.           In this role, you:             Translate business needs into functional requirements providing essential information on business use cases.         Translate functional requirements into thorough and feasible data products, analytics solutions and dynamic dashboards;         Utilize Python, PySpark, SQL, or R for data retrieval and manipulation.         Develop, test, and maintain data products, pipelines by the use of the Azure stack and Databricks, ensuring data reliability and quality.         Design and implement architectures for efficient data extraction and transformation.         Work on creating and maintaining landing zones in the data platform.         Actively participate in and contribute to Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) practices, ensuring smooth and efficient development and deployment processes within the data platform         Integrate data pipelines and reports into testing frameworks, allowing for rigorous performance testing and validation to ensure seamless performance.         Monitor and maintain data pipeline stability, offering support when required.         Analyze, interpret, and visualize data to drive business process optimization and fact-based decision-making.         Create, deploy, and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations using Qlik or Power BI.         Perform a comprehensive analysis and proactively implement solutions to assess and enhance data quality and data reliability.         Actively participate in delivery execution on the Data Platform         You are eager to improve yourself and strive for continuous enhancement of processes and development within the data platform.         Stay updated with the latest developments in the analytics field and share knowledge with the team.                   Your qualifications and skills           If you re an experienced, enthusiastic and versatile Analytics Engineer, you will bring:           Minimum bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).             0-3 years of prior experience working as an Analytics Engineer or in a similar role .         Ability to work effectively as part of a cross-functional international full stack team, collaborating with other developers, and stakeholders.         Practical experience in writing code in Python, PySpark, SQL, or R for data retrieval and manipulation is a strong preference.         Demonstrated experience and proficiency in working with Azure Stack and Databricks is required for this role.         Proficiency or interest in using DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration, continuous delivery (CI/CD), and automated deployment of data products and data pipelines         Strong communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.         Enthusiastic, proactive, driven, and actively seeking opportunities for personal development and growth.         Demonstrated curiosity and commitment to staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in the data & analytics field.         Familiar with agile methodologies and thrives in its dynamic and collaborative environment.         Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or Qlik is plus.

Proven track record of successfully conducting research/analytics for complex digital products, with measurable improvements in user experience.      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex requirements and create a matching research agenda.      Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex concepts and influence stakeholders.

column2: Job Description   Business Intelligence Professional Job Details   Job title Business Intelligence Professional    Why BT? Weve always been an organisation with purpose; to use the power of communications to make a better world. You can trace this back to our beginning as pioneers of the worlds first telecommunications company. At our heart were a technology company with research and innovation in our bones and a desire to be personal, simple, and brilliant for our customers - those are the values we live by whilst also creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed.   Our pursuit of progress over the past 180 years has established BT as a strong, successful brand, with huge scale capable of achieving great things. From supporting emergency services, hospitals, banks and keeping economies around the world online, safe and secure, to delivering large scale technology infrastructure like the creation of BT Sport.   Today in this fast changing, always on, digital world our purpose remains true. Yet the market conditions, regulation and competition we face are tougher than ever before. So if you have the drive, optimism and resilience to help propel us forward well offer unrivalled personal development, a wealth of opportunities to learn, experience new things and pursue new careers. If thats you and what you??e looking for, we?? love you to be part of our future.   Why Business Unit/Function We have around 1.2 million customers and serve over half the FTSE 350. Our customers range from big household names, government departments and public service organisations right through to small businesses and new start-ups. We cover both the communications and IT services markets. Overall we??e focused on four main product markets: Fixed Voice; Mobility; Fibre and connectivity; networked IT services provided over the biggest UK network in both fixed and mobile communications. We also provide network IT services to corporate and public sector organisations in the Republic of Ireland.   Our Wholesale business helps communications providers (CPs) and other organisations provide fixed or mobile phone services. Our ventures provide mass-market services like directory enquiries and payphones, and enterprise services including Fleet Solutions and BT Redcare. We also offer specialist enterprise services to our Internet of Things customers.   What I??l be doing ??your accountabilitiesSkills required for the job Specifically, this job is accountable for:-     Working with (often senior) stakeholders to design best-in-class reporting solutions using BT standard business intelligence software tools e.g. OBI, Qlik, Tableau Development and delivery of self-serve reporting solutions, ensuring highest quality and accuracy at all times  Taking the lead on ensuring personal skills are up to date and reflective of market trends in this specialised area Ensure all processes, data storage / handling and outputs comply with GDPR, and / or any other applicable compliance laws & regulations Manage BAU tasks including upkeep of existing reporting and improve with deploying available automation Story-telling with data:  Strong communication skills clearly translating complex concepts relating to data management, KPI, Visualization etc. that into meaningful business insights  Expert user of data visualisation tools primarily Qlik to help deliver key insights   Business acumen:  Knowledgeable in business strategy and the drivers of organisational performance, including people drivers of performance and financial literacy (e.g. business KPIs, business cases)   Technical :  Support with the build and maintenance of a central database for analytics and business intelligence Deep understanding of developing modern BI & Visualisation tools (and delivery of self-serve solutions in a business environment), including underlying data source handling and ETL development Must have a strong working knowledge of enterprise level databases, database architecture and SQL/BigQuery Cloud Solutions exposure, preferrabley GCP Story-telling with data - Strong communication skills clearly translating complex concepts relating to GBS and its stakeholders     3 Skills in demand most suitable to the job. Use data analytics : Uses knowledge and collection of data to support decisions. Delivers initiatives to improve data analytics in BT. Give specialised advice : Offers advice and makes recommendations based on expertise, suggesting solutions and improvements. Hold others to account : Understands expectations and manages themselves to high ethical and values standards. Will call out poor behaviour in others.   Able to manage expectations of several director level (n-3) stakeholders and effectively prioritise the workload / deliverables     BT ValuesExperience you would be expected to have Personal : Personal means we come across as human, and show our customers that we understand and care. Simple : Simple means we are straightforward, easy to deal with, and make complex things clear. Brilliant : Brilliant means we lead the way in creating new things, and whatever we do, we do it really well.  Preferred qualifications in BSc (Hons) in Digital and Technology Solutions, specialising in Data Analytics or BSc (Hons) in Computer Science or BSc (Hons) in Information and Communication Technology, B.tech in Computer Science, B.tech in Information and Technology   Preferred domain experience and expertise in the Business telecoms market, its products and systems, Financial Systems Key decisions If the job has key decision rights list these here (see RAPID guidance).   Recommends Prioritisation of workstack requirements and other deliverables

column2: Analyze data to identify trends, opportunities, and insights to improve sales and profitability on various marketplaces         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies for business growth         Monitor inventory levels and replenishment schedules for the FBA warehouses to ensure timely and accurate replenishments         Work with the buying team, vendor relationship team, and pricing team to develop pricing strategies to optimize sales and profitability         Implement AI technology like ChatGPT or equivalent AI tools to enforce automation of manual work within the BI and other departments         Create various business reports covering the sales, profitability, and performance of the FBA team across all levels using various BI tools         Develop statistical models to predict the replenishments of quantity to Amazon FBA         Ensure that the aged inventory at any given point in time does not exceed the threshold limits.                   Qualification:                 Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field         Minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or related field         Experience with Amazon FBA and other marketplaces         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills         Proficiency in SQL, Excel, BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI, and statistical analysis tools like R or Python         Excellent communication and presentation skills         Experience with implementing AI technology or ChatGPT or equivalent AI tools         Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment         Strong organizational and time-management skills                 Soft Skills:                 Leadership:    As a manager, you must be able to lead and inspire your team, set clear goals, and provide guidance to achieve them.       Communication:    Effective communication is vital to convey complex technical concepts, business insights, and project requirements to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.       Problem-Solving:    BI Managers encounter various challenges; hence, strong problem-solving skills are necessary to analyze situations, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions.       Analytical Thinking:    Your ability to analyze data and interpret insights will directly impact strategic decision-making, making analytical thinking a critical skill.       Decision-Making:    Managers in BI often face time-sensitive decisions. The capacity to make informed, data-driven decisions is paramount for success.       Team Building and Collaboration:    Building a cohesive team, fostering a collaborative environment, and promoting knowledge-sharing is key to enhancing the overall performance of your team.               Technical Skills:                 Data Warehousing:    Comprehensive knowledge of data warehousing concepts, methodologies, and tools is crucial to manage and optimize data storage and retrieval processes.       Business Intelligence Tools:    Proficiency in popular BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or others is essential for data visualization and reporting.       SQL:    A strong command of SQL is necessary to retrieve and manipulate data from various databases efficiently.       Data Modeling:    Understanding data models and designing effective data structures are fundamental to the success of BI projects.       ETL (Extract, Transform, Load):    Knowledge of ETL processes and tools is essential to extract data from multiple sources, transform it, and load it into the data warehouse.       Database Management Systems (DBMS):    Familiarity with various database systems and their optimization techniques is crucial for managing data effectively.

Advanced knowledge and practical application of Python, including utilizing NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Stats models, and other related libraries are required. column2: As a member of the Digital Sales Solutions Team, you will play a very important role in evolving the B2B Commerce experience for adidas customers. As a Senior Product Owner Customer Analytics, you are responsible for delivering cutting-edge analytics services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions. Define data needs and SLAs, enable self-service analytics, communication model and team branding                         Oversee the development of best practices of data analytics and establish them among markets in your area of responsibility as well as other adidas stakeholders to maximize the use of capabilities being built                         Build a strong internal and external network, informing the Global Sales and market B2B community on the latest trends and technological advances                         Key Relationships:                          Global: Global Sales Development, DPC, Global IT                         Markets: Market Sales Development, Key Account teams, Sales Directors, MDs, Markets Wholesale Click managers                         Customer Experience Commerce Team                         Digital Analytics and Data Analytics Department                         External partners and agencies                         Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:                          Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy                         Ability to see opportunities to improve and ability to use data to make your case                         Strong ability to visualize data in a compelling and meaningful way                         Extensive experience with modern analytics tech stack (such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, MicroStrategy, Power BI, SQL)                         Excellent stakeholder management abilities. column2: The Media Planning Tool Operator role offers the opportunity to gain knowledge of global media planning processes from planning to activation and will work within a dynamic environment with exposure to a variety of agency teams across 10-40 markets worldwide.     The media planning tool used is TukTuk (owned by Redmill) is a specialist media data management platform used as a reporting solution. The platform is an integral part of media ways of working to ensure consistency in across markets and requires ongoing central management from an ambitious individual with a strong eye for detail, to ensure the seamless delivery of accurate information to global stakeholders and local client teams. The role will involve working very closely with the central client services and operations team, as well as the local market teams who also use the TukTuk platform.     The successful candidate will be trained on both how to use the platform and read/create media plans. Once the trainings are completed the candidate will.       Manage and monitor the weekly global campaign status to ensure TukTuk is updated against planned activity.     Be working closely with central operations team and local markets, uploading all planned campaigns to the platform in addition to corresponding supporting documentation.     Be responsible for ensuring all central and local media plans and actualisations are reflected on Tuk-Tuk platform within global quarterly deadlines, sharing reports with central operations team to share with client contact.     Work with central operations team to resolve local queries.     Adhere to agreed ways of working and taxonomy processes (with assistance from dedicated TukTuk resource within activation hub).      Be responsible for requesting new users, removing existing users and changing user access in the TukTuk tool.     Have regular communication with markets to ensure they are up to date with any new TukTuk updates, changes, and general information regarding the tool.     Send fortnightly reminders to markets requesting Taxonomy updates and sharing final versions with Global client.           You will fit right in if you have -           Bachelor s or master s degree from a good university in Marketing, Advertising, Business Administration, and Communications (desired)     0 - 1 year of experienc

We help insurers redefine their customer experience while accelerating their innovation agenda to drive sustainable growth by transforming to an intelligent operating model. Intelligent Insurance Operations combines our advisory, technology, and operations expertise, global scale, and robust ecosystem with our insurance transformation capabilities. It is structured to address the scope and complexity of the ever-changing insurance environment and offers a flexible operating model that can meet the unique needs of each market segment.Catastrophe Risk Management refers to the process of guiding insurers how to manage risk aggregations, deploy capital, and price insurance coverage by using computer assisted calculations to estimate the losses that could be sustained due to a catastrophic event such as a hurricane or earthquake. column2: At Integrate, we treat data as a critical corporate asset and differentiator in our business. We are looking for an outstanding Associate Product Analytics Lead to help drive the effectiveness of our products through data.          You will be partnering with senior data science, data engineering, business and product leadership to do great things.          Ultimately your work will focus on measuring and improving corporate performance, product performance and outcomes for our customers.         You are passionate about problem-solving and always take a customer-centric approach.          You know how to energize cross-functional teams around a problem and use data to identify and prioritize solutions.          You are skilled at creating meaningful analysis with large, complex datasets and using the tools of your trade: query languages, ETL tools, data modeling & data visualization.          You are at your best when tackling new problems and supporting innovation.                 The Team:                   We are a diverse group o     f Integrators who believe that being smart about how we use data can lead to better products and more value for our clients. We dont just pull data and create analyses; we create compelling stories driven by the context of our customers and the vision of Integrate. We believe we are strongest when we support each other, and that learning is always p     art of the job.               Job Responsibilities                  Lead the measuring of success of each product including metrics that cover product performance, adoption and utilization, and outcomes.             Work with the key stakeholders to determine the measures of success and guide good usage of outcome driven metrics.             Compile user, transaction, and other data from complex systems to generate reports and analyses for partner and stakeholder groups.             Synthesize results to determine success or failure of experiments and make recommendations on go forward plan.             Develop and manage strong, collaborative relationships with associated data science, product team and other stakeholders, as needed, to help drive results.             Typical Qualifications                  5+ years professional experience, inclusive of a minimum of 3-5 years of data analytics              Ability to effectively create reports and synthesize data into digestible and actionable information. Ability to synthesize complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve business problems.             Knowledge of, and ability to use, strategies, techniques and tools for effective communication of technical ideas to various audiences. Strong understanding of database technologies and ability to write code to gather data.              Able to take a pro-active view of data analytics in the context of data-backed products and provide insights that can help drive increased adoption and use of our offerings.             Bachelor s Degree required; Degree (Bachelor s or Masters) in a quantitative discipline like Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or Mathematics.           Integrate in the News:           Best Tech Startups in Arizona (2018-2021)      Integrate Acquires Akkroo      Integrate Acquires ListenLoop      Why Four MarTech CEOs Bet Big on Integrate

Solution Design and Implementation:       Translate business requirements into comprehensive Odoo solution designs, considering scalability, performance, and integration needs     Configure Odoo Migration and System Administration:       Migrate existing data from legacy systems to Odoo, ensuring data integrity and consistency     Configure and manage Odoo user roles and permissions Manage a group of 7 Senior and Lead Analysts who are part of 2 data product teams in the Customer CARE and Design Analytics area and guide their professional development through development plans, performance management, and on-the-job coaching.             Drive functional excellence and best practices across the domain regarding the analytics way of working and results, like metrics definition, target definition, data modelling, data-driven operational performance management, quality assurance, and data visualization - leveraging an agile continuous improvement mechanism.             Support and contribute to important projects in the domain and collaborate in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.             Collaborate with CARE, analytics, engineering, and other business colleagues from all over the world who understand the value of a truly diverse and cross-functional workplace. At Vista, your voice and expertise are heard!                   Your Qualifications:                     Passionate about developing people.    Experience and strong focus on developing people, coach them to improve their performance, deal with issues constructively, and help them grow; help to establish a feedback culture.               Passionate about data and technology.    Strong Experience in SQL and in creating great self-service dashboards, eg, in Tableau or Looker. Other programming languages/analytics platforms (eg, Python, R, Google Analytics) and experience with hypothesis testing is a strong plus.               Experience in driving functional excellence.    Able to continuously improve processes, quality of data and analysis with the teams in the domain and with external data source providers.               A resourceful and pro-active problem solver.    Strong analytical thinking, excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail, an ability to effectively deliver on projects and support multiple business partners as we'll as a drive to pro-actively see, follow-up, and resolve analytical problems.               Customer focused and partnering with stakeholders.    Ability to not just think about improving the end customer experience, but also to build intuitive analytics tools by partnering closely with the internal user - advising and educating them on data-related topics and help the team to develop and follow a data-driven approach to Product Development.                Inquisitive by nature.    Comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and able to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data; ability to tackle complex problems, drawing inferences from data, and create workable solutions based on business rules.               Experienced   . Minimum 7 years of experience in analytics and analytics/people management, preferably in eCommerce environment. bachelors degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field from a top-notch university. Experience in tech startups or management consulting and is a plus.

Collaborates with Capability Owners to understand and influence the overarching strategy for assigned capabilities and aides in the development of digital measurement plans. Maintains detailed documentation on new and existing digital data assets. Collaborates with Capability Managers, Owners, IT, Business Analysts, and the rest of the Digital Analytics team to prioritize the approved work list.     Develops detailed analytics (business & technology) requirements, feature definitions and implementation plans for digital products and capabilities. Supports or refutes hypothesis via data extracts and analysis, providing data driven insights on business value of assigned capabilities and proposed digital enhancements. Minimum Qualifications   :     Degree    Required   : Bachelor s Degree     Area of Study: Analytics, Decision Science, Mathematics         Years of Work Experience    Required   : Two or more years     Type / focus of work experience required: Digital analytics reporting tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), experience with SQL or other database query languages, strong understanding of the Internet, online shopping, web design/layout and navigation, advanced excel skills             Preferred Experience:       Years of Work Experience    Preferred   : Three years or more     Type / focus of work experience preferred: Digital analytics, Marketing analytics, Retail and/or ecommerce

Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies. Staying up to date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems. Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Performing requirements analysis. Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts. Business Analyst Requirements:   A minimum of 7+ years experience in business analysis or a related field. Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills. The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Advanced technical skills. Excellent documentation skills. Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook. A history of leading and supporting successful projects.  Experience on CRM or eCommerce, Banking domain will be preferred.

column2: Role Description The ICG client analytics role is focused on generating insightful and actionable analytics to enable our global Fixed Income sales teams and sales leadership to drive profitability and revenues. The role includes conceptualizing and delivering analytical frameworks, generating useful Management Information reports and conducting data driven deep-dives into our client franchise. The role is critical in bringing together information pertaining to our clients together from various parts of the bank and thus providing comprehensive client centric analysis. Your key responsibilities  Production, enhancement, maintenance, and distribution of Global MI related to our Fixed Income client franchise Data quality controls, enabling translation transformation of data to stitch together disparate data sources and drive data clean-up Drive our effort to industrialize analytics and build strategic platforms Support Management teams with investigations, deep dives, adhoc analysis reports and similar insights into their respective business areas Monitor progress on key business initiatives and ambitions quantitatively with a view to identify early signals of risks opportunities. Socialize findings, identified opportunities risks, recommendations to sales and management teams Your skills and experience CA MBA from a premier institution, preferably with a focus on finance, economics, business administration, business informatics (or equivalent) Experience in Analytical & reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau and advanced Excel Experience with Client Management CRM tools (e.g. Salesforce, MS Dynamics) is a plus Strong computer skills, particularly in dealing with high volume of data, management of databases and Excel. Advanced exposure to Word and PowerPoint is required Basic experience in data exploration mining tools like SQL is a plus Strong MI background with high data interpretation skills and data mining ability Very strong analytical skill and ability to think laterally Strong interpersonal skills with excellent verbal and written communication skills, stakeholder management & teamwork Flexible and adaptive approach to work and willingness to take initiative challenge status quo Ability to work independently and under tight deadline

column2: Skill required:  Property & Casualty - Catastrophe Risk Management Designation:  Analytics and Modeling Associate Qualifications: BE/BTech/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? We help insurers redefine their customer experience while accelerating their innovation agenda to drive sustainable growth by transforming to an intelligent operating model. Intelligent Insurance Operations combines our advisory, technology, and operations expertise, global scale, and robust ecosystem with our insurance transformation capabilities. It is structured to address the scope and complexity of the ever-changing insurance environment and offers a flexible operating model that can meet the unique needs of each market segment.Claims settlements related any client property they own or any accidentsCatastrophe Risk Management refers to the process of guiding insurers how to manage risk aggregations, deploy capital, and price insurance coverage by using computer assisted calculations to estimate the losses that could be sustained due to a catastrophic event such as a hurricane or earthquake. What are we looking for? Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Collaboration and interpersonal skills Corporate planning & strategic planning Problem-solving skills Written and verbal communication  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments The decisions that you make would impact your own work You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BE,BTech,Master of Business Administration

column2: The Lead Business Growth & Product Analyst s role is to plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes.          Your primary responsibility will be to analyze user behavior, identify opportunities, and execute strategies to increase user acquisition/activation, retention, and engagement. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, marketing specialists, and data engineers, to achieve our growth objectives.          This includes gathering, analyzing, and presenting data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. The Lead Business Analyst is also responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and workable solutions to systems issues.          This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT / Analytics system investments.                         Responsibilities                     ?         Strategy & Planning for Business Analysis:                  Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and Application/systems/ Business goals, and identify and resolve problems/ issues.             Lead analysis for product/content experimentation, Business (Product, Monetization, Financial) data review sessions or analysis of prototyping new systems to enhance business processes, operations, and information process flow. Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.              Identify and establish scope and data requirements/ parameters of systems analysis to define outcome criteria and measure-taking actions.          Operational Management for Business Analytics:             Prepare and deliver reports, financial models, business operating plans, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems across the organization / experience units.             Create system design proposals.             Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.             Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.             Create systems models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to system programmers.             Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support.             Provide orientation and training to end users for all modified and new systems. 7. Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members or other members from cross-functional teams                         Product Growth & Analysis                     ?         Perform comprehensive Product data analysis:                     Analyze life stage, user behavior, conversion funnels, and retention patterns to identify growth opportunities.              Monitor A/B testing and experiments to measure the impact of changes and initiatives.        Utilize analytical tools and techniques to extract actionable insights from large datasets           Develop and execute growth models:                     Design and implement user acquisition and retention models to drive organic and paid growth.              Collaborate with the marketing team to optimize campaigns and improve conversion rates.              Identify product optimization opportunities based on user feedback and data analysis.                      Monitor and report key performance metrics:                     Track and report on key growth metrics such as user acquisition, conversion rates, engagement and revenue.              Live dashboard for internal and external stakeholders                      Collaborate with cross-functional teams:                     Work closely with business, product and engineering team        Work with external partners for ensuring that the data s accuracy and usability           Stay updated on industry trends and best practices:                     Monitor industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging growth strategies with a special focus on AI.        Stay abreast of new tools, methodologies, and advancements in growth analytics.                Data as a new business                     Work towards making data itself as a new business                  Qualifications:                     Bachelors or masters degree in a relevant field such as Business, Statistics, Data Science, or a related discipline.              4-6 years of proven experience as a Management Consultant, Growth Analyst, business analyst, product analyst Growth Marketer, or similar role within an Android app business.,              Strong analytical skills with expertise in data analysis, A/B testing, and experimentation and presenting the data to leadership.             Proficiency in MS- Office Suits (Excel & PPT), SQL, Python and experience working with large datasets.              Proficient in using analytical tools such as Power BI, Google Analytics, Moengage/Clevertap, Firebase, and similar platforms.              Hands on experience with Databricks and Azure platform is a plus.             Knowledge of business analytics and reporting, mobile app analytics, attribution, and user tracking methodologies.              Experience with growth hacking strategies and tools to drive user acquisition and retention.              Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.              Strong problem-solving abilities and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.              Familiarity with the Android ecosystem, app stores, and mobile app development is a plus.              Passion for mobile technologies, apps, and staying updated on industry trends.

column2: Senior Analyst, Prescient Intelligence & Insight India  Gurugram   About You Have you decided that biopharma consulting is for you? Are you looking to become the catalyst between clinical and commercial success? Prescient is looking for post-graduates and early-career consultants to join us as Senior Analyst for our growing Intelligence & Insight business in India.  Do you have: Knowledge of development and commercialisation aspects of the biopharmaceutical industry, especially in the US and EU? Experience      supporting highly complex biosimilars, oncology or immunology projects A      sound understanding of treatment paradigms, unmet needs and market trends? A      creative and analytical mind with the ability and desire to source      relevant insight through secondary data analytics and primary research? Excellent      communication skills, both written and oral, and the ability to operate      effectively as part of a global team? If so, consider turning your expertise into a valuable career at Prescient. About Prescient Intelligence & Insight  Prescient Intelligence & Insight, a Prescient Healthcare Group business, offers best-in-class biopharmaceutical intelligence by providing impactful insight and decision support to product and portfolio teams from early clinical development through to loss of exclusivity. About the Opportunity As a Senior Analyst your time will be divided as follows:  70%      conducting secondary research 30%      conducting primary research.  You will be part of a fast-growing PE-backed business that allows high-performing employees to make an impact and contribute to growing the business. You will have the chance to channel your advanced degree into supporting the development and commercialisation of portfolios, assets, and brands by integrating therapeutic, clinical and commercial expertise to ensure that clients are able to make confident decisions.  Through effective collection and analysis of market, competitor, and stakeholder information, you will be responsible for supporting intelligence and insight engagements across our clients??product and company life cycles.  As your clients will be global, the Senior Analyst position requires an understanding of the evolving biopharmaceutical market and trends. Knowledge of drug development and commercialisation is also desirable. Reporting : You will report to a      senior executive within Prescient?? India office Time      Allocation :      80% of your time will be spent in office, with 20% spent on domestic or      international travel (for client meetings, conferences and inter-office      visits) Key Responsibilities Evidence      Generation: Secondary       Data Analytics: Source, analyse and report published information, be it       scientific, clinical, commercial, corporate or regulatory. Primary       Research: Collect market, competitor and stakeholder evidence through       desk-based interviewing and elicitation. Analysis      and Reporting:  Collaborate      with other members of the project team to analyse findings, develop      insights and implications, and create client presentations that deliver a      linear, evidence-based story on the topics in focus. Conference      Attendance:  Cover      key conferences with the objectives of interacting with a wide range of      experts and delegates and attending key symposia, presentations, posters,      and booths. Maintenance      of Knowledge Assets:  Build data repositories linked to      specific therapeutic areas, market dynamics and regulatory dynamics Required Experience and Skills One      or more of the following degrees in the life sciences: MTech      (biotechnology or related areas); MPharm; MSc/MBA combination More      than 2 years of professional experience, of which at least 1 was focused      in oncology and/or immunology and/or biosimilars consulting Confident      communication skills to work effectively with global colleagues and      contribute to client reports Analytical      skills with the ability to collect, organise and disseminate significant      amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Ability      to contribute value-added insights to available information Understanding      of drug development and commercialisation processes Excellent      knowledge of MS Office applications (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) Enthusiasm      to expand skill set and learn about the business and the market Fluency      in English What We Offer Competitive      package and remuneration linked to performance Opportunity      to support pharmaceutical and biotech client accounts through tough      business problems related to their portfolios, assets and brand strategies. High-growth,      entrepreneurial environment where you can create significant client and      business value and forge your own path Platform      for accelerated professional development and career growth with      significant levels of responsibility and accountability Opportunity      to be mentored by seasoned industry professionals, become expert in      cutting-edge therapies and be exposed to senior-level client decision making. About Prescient Healthcare Group Prescient? is a pharmaceutical services firm specialising in dynamic decision support and the development of product and portfolio strategies. We partner with our clients to turn science into value by helping them understand the potential of their molecules, shaping their strategic plans and allowing their decision making to be the biggest differentiating factor in the success of their products. When companies partner with Prescient, the molecules in their hands have a greater potential for success than the same science in the hands of their competitors. Founded in 2007, Prescient is a global firm with a footprint in 10 cities across three continents. Our team of nearly 475 experts partners with 27 of the top 30 biopharmaceutical companies, the fastest-growing mid-caps and cutting-edge emerging biotechnology companies, including some of the biggest and most innovative brands. More than 70% of our employees hold advanced life sciences degrees, and our teams deliver an impressive depth of therapeutic, clinical and commercial expertise. Prescient has been a portfolio company of Bridgepoint Development Capital since 2021 and Baird Capital since 2017. For more information, please visit www.prescienthg.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and fully comply with applicable legislation in all the geographies in which we operate. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to veteran status, uniformed service member status, race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other category protected by applicable national, federal, state or local laws.

You will identify opportunities where AI can be leveraged to create competitive advantage and solve complex challenges to deliver exceptional business outcome. Industry and functional consultation experience. Expertise in providing proposals and business architectures, presentations.  Should have participated in multiple AI based RFP submission. column2: The Global sales & revenue analytics team is responsible to upscale the org towards data driven strategic decision making by adding the intelligence layer on top of InMobi s robust and complex data - to unlock the revenue potential through analytics, storytelling, and go-to-market strategy      This intelligence layer will be consumed towards realizing efficiencies, unlocking productivity, assessing health of each of our global revenue units      This team, your role, in collaboration with Strategy & Operations team (CEO office) will be instrumental in ensuring our journey towards intelligent decision making that will drive the organization to achieve its aggressive revenue growth goals      You will be able to create impact across the organization (Data, Systems, Process and People), that has implications on day-to-day business and organizational health metrics              Who you are            Analytical:    You appreciate a good spreadsheet, are comfortable with big data sets and are meticulous in your metrics. You have a track record of driving actionable insights that result in measurable growth        A Do-er    : You can execute on complex and ambiguous projects with conviction & good judgement and need minimal guidance & direction        Collaborative by nature    : You have experience partnering cross-functionally with Product, Finance, Marketing and HR, amongst other groups. You re a strong team player and can work effectively with others across time zones in a global set up        A strategic thinker    : You lean on your market experience and commercial instincts to build and drive the company s growth strategy          What will you be doing?          Identify key performance metrics and build exec-facing dashboards to track progress of our high priority revenue initiatives.      Build effective visualisations to communicate data to key decision-makers using data story telling      Build predictable mechanisms through data science and machine learning models to track revenue, forecast risks and flag any deviations that may lead to the businesses missing their respective goals. In addition to revenue, also build ways to accurately track the hygiene metrics for the revenue units across engagement, retention etc.      Help with data backed insights to drive medium & long-term strategy for the business and monthly/quarterly planning & review exercises for different revenue units      Leverage your intellectual curiosity to understand the company s underlying business and technical challenges and translating them to into long-term leading and lagging performance indicators that are applicable across business units.      Leverage analytics and actionable insights to partner directly with the GTM leadership on strategic, organizational, and operational initiatives designed to increase revenue, sales productivity, operational efficiency and forecasting accuracy      Own and deliver ad-hoc strategic projects for key initiatives that could involve building narratives to drive internal conviction and backing them up with data to validate or negate hypotheses that GTM teams would want to test out for potential new revenue levers      Work closely with sales team to identify the areas of strengths to capitalize on and opportunities that we are lagging behind on to increase the client and thus revenue for our products      Establish processes and build products that solve for generating intelligent reports and reduce information overdose while focussing on meaningful consumption of insights within the company      Communicate your findings to cross-functional peers and management      Independently collaborate with stakeholders and leaders across various Business units, central strategy, product, sales tech, finance, delivery to align on cross-functional processes that support data integrity and governance & keep improving outcomes and efficiency of initiatives being driven within the unit      Build models to detect anomalies, investigate and resolve data discrepancies between systems.      Automate whatever you can!          What are we looking for?        Skills and Attributes:        Gain deep knowledge of many facets of the mobile advertising business such as ad operations, creative services, project management, sales efficiency and productivity      Quickly grasp external and internal ad tech nuance and leverage to meet business growth      Develop knowledge of all our data sources and quickly be the go-to-person for extracting and analysing data from these sources.      Proven ability to wrangle large datasets, extracting insights from data, and summarising learnings / takeaways and drive decision making for various business units leaders      Ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies for data collection and analysis      Present insights/findings in a structured manner to directly enable tangible outcomes for stakeholders      Understand critical interdependencies across functions and divisions, and grasp the short and long-term trade-offs of business decisions.      Demonstrated aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data      Experience with Excel and some dashboarding/data visualisation (i. e. PowerBI, Tableau or similar)      Experience with SQL/R/Python for data analysis      5+ years of overall work experience within a Tech/Consulting/Analytics industry      4+ years of relevant management experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role      4+ years of work experience with SQL/Python/R, Advanced Excel, any data visualisation tool (Tableau or PowerBI)      Prior experience within the Adtech industry is a plus      Should have developed and implemented at least 3 analytics solutions (end to end) which includes translating a business problem into a data analytics problem and providing a sustainable solution      Trustworthy with high integrity, and ability to maintain appropriate confidentiality      Patience and stamina to translate long term roadmap into wins and milestones for organizational impact      Execution-driven and results-oriented to ensure strategy translates to outcomes      Efficient planning and execution      Project management abilities: ability to manage long-term (multi-month) integrations, set timelines, and independently drive the process forward.      Ability to deliver on tight timelines and prioritise multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail      Ability to mentor, coach and develop junior team members      Plan and lead complex projects, prioritise tasks and map stakeholders appropriately      Excellent written and verbal communication skills

column2: Associate, Prescient Intelligence & Insight India Gurugram About You Have you decided that biopharmaceutical consulting is for you? Are you looking to become the catalyst between clinical and commercial success? Prescient is looking for post-graduates and early-career consultants to join us as Associates for our growing Intelligence & Insight business in India. Do you have: Knowledge of the development and commercialisation aspects of the biopharmaceutical industry, especially in the US and EU? Experience supporting highly complex biosimilars, oncology or immunology projects? A sound understanding of treatment paradigms, unmet needs and market trends? A creative and analytical mind, with the ability and desire to source relevant insight through secondary data analytics and primary research? Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, and the ability to operate effectively as part of a global team?   If so, consider turning your expertise into a valuable career at Prescient. About Prescient Intelligence & Insight Prescient Intelligence & Insight, a Prescient Healthcare Group business, offers best-in-class biopharmaceutical intelligence by providing impactful insight and decision support to product and portfolio teams, from early clinical development through to loss of exclusivity. About the Opportunity As an Associate, your time will be divided as follows: 70% conducting secondary research 30% conducting primary research You will be part of a fast-growing, PE-backed business that allows high-performing employees to make an impact and contribute to growing the business. You will have the chance to channel your advanced degree into supporting the development and commercialisation of portfolios, assets and brands by integrating therapeutic, clinical and commercial expertise to ensure that clients can make confident decisions. Through the effective collection and analysis of market, competitor and stakeholder information, you will be responsible for supporting intelligence and insight engagements across our clients product and company life cycles. As your clients will be global, the Associate position requires an understanding of the evolving biopharmaceutical market and trends. Knowledge of drug development and commercialisation is also desirable. Reporting : You will report to a senior executive within Prescient?? India office Time Allocation : 80% of your time will be spent in office, with 20% spent on domestic or international travel (for client meetings, conferences and inter-office visits) Key Responsibilities Evidence Generation : Secondary Data Analytics: Source, analyse and report published information, be it scientific, clinical, commercial, corporate or regulatory Primary Research: Collect market, competitor and stakeholder evidence through desk-based interviewing and elicitation Analysis and Reporting : Collaborate with other members of the project team to analyse findings, develop insights and implications, and create client presentations that deliver a linear, evidence-based story on the topics in focus Conference Attendance : Cover key conferences with the objectives of interacting with a wide range of experts and delegates and attending key symposia, presentations, posters and booths Maintenance of Knowledge Assets : Build data repositories linked to specific therapeutic areas, market dynamics and regulatory dynamics Required Experience and Skills One or more of the following degrees in the life sciences: MTech (biotechnology or related areas), MPharm and/or MSc/MBA combination More than two years of professional experience, of which at least one was focused on oncology and/or immunology and/or biosimilars consulting Confident communication skills to work effectively with global colleagues and contribute to client reports Analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organise and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Ability to contribute value-added insights to available information Understanding of drug development and commercialisation processes Excellent knowledge of MS Office applications (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) Enthusiasm to expand your skill set and learn about the business and the market Fluency in English What We Offer Competitive package and remuneration linked to performance Opportunity to support pharmaceutical and biotech client accounts through tough business problems related to their portfolios, assets and brand strategies High-growth, entrepreneurial environment where you can create significant client and business value and forge your own path Platform for accelerated professional development and career growth, with significant levels of responsibility and accountability Opportunity to be mentored by seasoned industry professionals, become an expert in cutting-edge therapies and be exposed to senior-level client decision making About Prescient Healthcare Group Prescient? is a pharmaceutical services firm specialising in dynamic decision support and the development of product and portfolio strategies. We partner with our clients to turn science into value by helping them understand the potential of their molecules, shaping their strategic plans and allowing their decision making to be the biggest differentiating factor in the success of their products. When companies partner with Prescient, the molecules in their hands have a greater potential for success than the same science in the hands of their competitors. Founded in 2007, Prescient is a global firm with a footprint in 10 cities across three continents. column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making that will allow us to tackle some of the world s greatest health threats.      Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management.      Deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.      In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. As we endeavour, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of    Senior Analyst - Advanced Analytics       We are looking for a team member to support our analytics team based out of US. The core of the role is to be a trusted business partner having deep data mining expertise and a strong advanced analytical skill set. column2: Role & responsibilities   1.    Data Collection and Collation :  Gathering and consolidating data from various operations and business units in a systematic and organized manner.  Ensuring that all relevant information and data are strategically captured and stored in a centralized location.  Identifying and collecting data from disparate sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and other systems. 2.    Data Cleaning and Preparation:  Ensuring accuracy and quality of the collected data by cleaning and preparing it for analysis.  Filtering out irrelevant data, handling missing values, and transforming the collected data into a suitable format for analysis.  This step is critical to ensure that the insights drawn from the data are reliable and actionable. 3 .    Data Exploration and Analysis:  Using statistical tools and techniques, such as Excel or specialized software, to explore and analyze the collected data.  Identifying patterns, relationships, and trends, as well as testing hypotheses and making predictions.  Gaining a deeper understanding of the data and uncover insights that can inform business decisions. 4.    Data Visualization:  Presenting complex data insights clearly and concisely using visual aids such as dashboards, charts, and reports.  Helping stakeholders quickly grasp key findings and make informed decisions.  Data visualization also enables the identification of trends and patterns that may not be immediately apparent from merely reviewing raw data. 5.    Reporting:  Communicating insights and findings from the analyzed data to stakeholders through reports and presentations.  Providing recommendations for improvement, highlighting areas for further investigation, and summarizing key findings. 6.    Engagement & Collaboration:  Fostering close relationships with managers from various departments to understand their specific data needs and requirements.  Collaborating with members of senior management and other departmental heads to prioritize needs of different business units, ensuring that the data analysis is focused on the most critical areas of that business.  This involves active listening, effective communication, and adaptability to changing priorities and requirements. Preferred candidate profile   Adaptable and able to work in dynamic environments. Strong understanding of mechanical/electrical systems. Excellent data collection, analysis, and problem-solving skills. Data-driven outlook with attention to detail. Strong organizing, communication, and soft-spoken skills. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Big-picture thinking and vision. Fluency in English and Hindi. MS Excel and related tools (MUST HAVE) MS PowerPoint and related tools. (MUST HAVE) Understanding of basic statistics. (MUST HAVE) MS Word (MUST HAVE) Exhibit exceptional analytical abilities from compiling data sets to structure and examine data sets with precision and thoroughness. (MUST HAVE) Power BI (Desirable to Have) SPSS, R, SAS (Desirable to Have) Perks and benefits   As per industry standards and rules and regulations promulgated by the Government from time to time.

The role is responsible for leading the execution of cutting-edge advanced data science and analytics initiatives for the Global Aftersales Parts team and also develop and grow the analytics capabilities for the team reporting to the role. The role will translate, summarize, and present large and complex datasets in an easily understandable manner, making is possible to spot patterns, trends and correlations. This position design and deploy effective data pipelines, data visualizations and storytelling techniques to generate insights from data. The role will have people management responsibilities along with being a hands-on analytics professional solving different use cases to provide value for different business units within the Aftersales Parts organization.                            Your Impact                     Works with senior management and key Aftersales Parts Business stake holders in identifying and prioritizing actionable, impactful insights across a variety of core business fronts, driving informed decision-making across the business domains.                 Works with business stakeholders and functional domain experts to map reporting requirements into dashboards and BI tools.                  Visualizes data and analytical insights for easy consumption for business using reports, dashboards, and scorecards. Uses storytelling to explain business insights to stakeholders.                 Adheres to enterprise visualization standards and best practices. Optimizes performance of the queries involving on the fly calculations                 Build wireframes and mock-ups of dashboards and reports as needed to deliver effective data visualizations.                  Defines the integration points with other systems and communication of the effects of possible system changes in cooperation with other teams.                 Explores large datasets to determine their characteristics and select appropriate visualizations.                  Works with cloud technologies to develop and deploy efficient data ingestion pipelines integrating multiple data sources.                  Acts as a change agent to drive data driven decision making within the organization.                 Possess extensive knowledge and technical know-how on data visualization and data engineering technologies / processes to build robust and reliable data visualizations and analytics solutions.                 Leads the development of machine learning and AI to develop advanced analytics models with a focus on predictive or prescriptive use cases.                 Stays up to date on leading data science and visualization practices, trends, design, learning and development cycles.                          Your Experience and Qualifications                     Full-time bachelor s degree Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Software Technology (Minimum). Master s degree in engineering or business (Preferred).                 5+ years of Experience with Data Visualization Tools (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI)                  5+ years of Experience in data models, data warehousing, data ingestion concepts, relational databases and various data management methods and techniques                 5+ years of Experience with building data integrations and pipelines from/to Salesforce Marketing Cloud & Sales Cloud, SAP, and internal CRM systems                  3+ years of Experience of working with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP etc...)                 Knowledge of data structures of ERP and CRM Systems (Microsoft Dynamics 365, SAP, Salesforce, etc.)                 Hands-on experience in working with SQL, R, Spark or Python and Excel                  8-10 years as a Project, Program or Product Management with experience leading global initiatives.                 3+ years of Global experience driving enterprise level Change Management cross functionally.                 Strong communication / interpersonal skills, capable of interacting with multiple levels of IT and business management.                 Effective working relationship with the business to ensure business requirements are accurately captured agreed, accepted and implemented.                 Certifications in the area of Data Science, Data Engineering , Data Visualization and Business Intelligence                  Professional Experience of working with Salesforce suite of tools

column2: Responsible for analyzing and interpreting large sets of data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can inform business decisions. Proficient in using data analysis tools, statistical methods, and data visualization software.     Responsibilities:       Using statistical techniques and data analysis software to identify patterns and trends in the data.     Identifying opportunities to improve business processes and outcomes based on the analysis of data.     Ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and consistency by performing quality control checks and data cleaning.     Developing and maintaining data models, databases, and other data management systems.     Should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as a deep understanding of statistical concepts and methods.      They should be proficient in data analysis software such as Python, R, or SAS, as well as data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio
